Economy","slug":"crypto-economy","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576863416"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576863416"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576863416"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576863416"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576863416"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2127801,"date":"2021-03-20T13:00:07","date_gmt":"2021-03-20T20:00:07","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2127801"},"modified":"2021-03-19T16:11:54","modified_gmt":"2021-03-19T23:11:54","slug":"tech-companies-predict-the-economic-future","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/20\/tech-companies-predict-the-economic-future\/","title":{"rendered":"Tech companies predict the (economic) future"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\"><em>Welcome back to The TechCrunch Exchange, a weekly startups-and-markets newsletter. It\u2019s broadly based on\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/the-exchange\/\">the daily column that appears on Extra Crunch<\/a>, but free, and made for your weekend reading. Want it in your inbox every Saturday morning? Sign up\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/newsletters\">here<\/a>.<\/em><\/p>\n<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Earnings season is coming to a close, with public tech companies wrapping up their Q4 and 2020 disclosures. We don\u2019t care too much about the bigger players\u2019 results here at TechCrunch, but smaller tech companies we knew when they were wee startups can provide startup-related data points worth digesting. So, each quarter The Exchange spends time chatting with a host of CEOs and CFOs, trying to figure what\u2019s going on so that we can relay the information to private companies.<\/p>\n<p>Sometimes it\u2019s useful, as our chat with <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/11\/05\/inside-fintech-startup-upstarts-ipo-filing\/\">recent fintech IPO Upstart<\/a> proved after we got <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/ai-fintech-products-are-operating-at-scale-and-investor-interest-is-maturing\/\">to noodle with the company<\/a> about rising acceptance of AI in the conservative banking industry.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>This week we caught up with Yext CEO <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/howard\">Howard Lerman<\/a> and Smartsheet CEO <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/markmader\">Mark Mader<\/a>. Yext builds data products for small businesses, and is <a href=\"https:\/\/www.mediapost.com\/publications\/article\/361531\/how-yext-moves-website-search-closer-to-a-google-l.html\">betting its future on search products<\/a>. Smartsheet is a software company that works in the collaboration, no-code and future-of-work spaces.<\/p>\n<p>They are pretty different companies, really. But what they did share this time &#8217;round the earnings cycle were macro notes, or details regarding their forward financial guidance and what economic conditions they anticipate. As a macro-nerd, it piqued my interest.<\/p>\n<p>Yext cited a number of macroeconomic headwinds when it reported its Q4 results. And tying its future results somewhat to an uncertain macro picture, the company <a href=\"https:\/\/www.fool.com\/earnings\/call-transcripts\/2021\/03\/03\/yext-inc-yext-q4-2021-earnings-call-transcript\/\">said that it is<\/a> \u201cbasing [its] guidance on the business conditions [it sees for itself] and [its] customers currently, with the macro economy, which remains sluggish, and customers who remain cautious,\u201d per a transcript.<\/p>\n<p>Lerman told The Exchange that it was not clear when the world would open &#8212; something that matters for Yext\u2019s location-focused products &#8212; so the company was guiding for the year as if nothing would change. Wall Street didn\u2019t love it, but if the economy improves Yext won\u2019t have high hurdles to jump over. This is one tack that a company can take when it talks guidance.<\/p>\n<p>Smartsheet took a slightly different approach, saying in <a href=\"https:\/\/www.fool.com\/earnings\/call-transcripts\/2021\/03\/16\/smartsheet-inc-smar-q4-2021-earnings-call-transcri\/\">its earnings call<\/a> that its \u201cfiscal year &#8217;22 guidance contemplates a gradual improvement in the macro environment in the second half of the year.\u201d Mader said in an interview that his company wasn\u2019t hiring economists, but was instead simply listening to what others were saying.<\/p>\n<p>He also said that the macro climate matters more in saturated markets, which he doesn\u2019t think that Smartsheet is in; so, its results should be more impacted by things more like \u201cthe secular shift to the cloud and digital transformation,\u201d to quote its earnings call.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"KkH7W7LI1B\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/ai-fintech-products-are-operating-at-scale-and-investor-interest-is-maturing\/\">AI fintech products are operating at scale and investor interest is maturing<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;AI fintech products are operating at scale and investor interest is maturing&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/ai-fintech-products-are-operating-at-scale-and-investor-interest-is-maturing\/embed\/#?secret=KkH7W7LI1B\" data-secret=\"KkH7W7LI1B\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>What the economy will do this year matters quite a lot for startups. An improving economy could boost interest rates, making money a bit more expensive and bonds more attractive. Valuations could see modest downward pressure in that case. And venture capital could slow fractionally. But with Yext forecasting as if it was facing a flat road and Smartsheet only expecting things to pick up pace from Q3 on, it\u2019s likely that what we have now is mostly what we\u2019ll get.<\/p>\n<p>And things are pretty damn good for startups and late-stage liquidity at the moment. So, smooth sailing ahead for startup-land? At least as far as our current perspective can discern.<\/p>\n<p>We still have a grip of notes from Splunk CEO Douglas Merritt on how to take an old-school software company and turn it into a cloud-first company, and Jamf CEO Dean Hager about packaging discrete software products. More to come from them in fits.<\/p>\n<h2>Various and sundry<\/h2>\n<p>There were rounds big and small this week. Companies like <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/16\/squarespace-raises-300m-at-staggering-10b-valuation\/\">Squarespace raised $300 million<\/a>, while Airtable <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/airtable-is-now-valued-at-5-77b-with-a-fresh-270-million-in-series-e-funding\/\">raised $277 million<\/a>. On the smaller-end of the spectrum, my favorite round of the week was a <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/gpt-3-powered-copy-ai-raises-2-9m-in-a-round-led-by-craft-ventures\/\">modest $2.9 million raise from Copy.ai<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>But there were other rounds that TechCrunch didn\u2019t get to that are still worth our time. So, here are a few more for you to dig into this weekend:<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">A so-called pre-Series A round for <a href=\"https:\/\/www.intelligentlilli.com\/\">Lilli<\/a>, a U.K.-based startup that uses sensors and other tech to track the well-being of folks who might need help to live on their own. Using tech to take care of folks is always good by me. The deal was worth \u00a34.5 million, <a href=\"https:\/\/www.uktech.news\/news\/uk-saas-company-lilli-funding-20210318\">per UKTN<\/a>.<\/li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">An IPO for Tuya, a Chinese software company that <a href=\"https:\/\/finance.yahoo.com\/news\/china-tuya-poised-raise-915-012627944.html\">raised $915 million in its American debut<\/a>. Chinese IPOs on American indices were once a big deal. They are less frequent now. Surprised that I missed this one, but, hey, there\u2019s been a lot going on.<\/li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">And the Republic round, <a href=\"https:\/\/www.businesswire.com\/news\/home\/20210317005272\/en\/Republic-Announces-36M-Series-A-to-Democratize-Access-to-Investing-for-Everyone\">worth $36 million<\/a>, that is banking on the recently-expanded American crowdfunding regulations. Some startups have seen success with the approach, <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/01\/23\/how-vcs-and-founders-see-2021-differently\/\">including Juked.gg<\/a>.<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"IfKoKf4Peb\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/forget-medicine-in-the-future-you-might-get-prescribed-apps\/\">Forget medicine, in the future you might get prescribed apps<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Forget medicine, in the future you might get prescribed apps&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/forget-medicine-in-the-future-you-might-get-prescribed-apps\/embed\/#?secret=IfKoKf4Peb\" data-secret=\"IfKoKf4Peb\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<h2>Upcoming attractions<\/h2>\n<p>Next week is Y Combinator Demo Day week, so expect a lot of early-stage coverage on the blog. Here\u2019s a preview. From The Exchange we\u2019re looking back into insurtech (with data from WeFox and Insurify), and talking about Austin-based software startup AlertMedia\u2019s decision to sell itself to private-equity instead of raising more traditional capital.<\/p>\n<p>And to leave you with some reading material, make sure you\u2019ve picked through our look at <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/what-etoros-investor-presentation-and-10b-valuation-tells-us-about-robinhood\/\">the valuations<\/a> of free-trading apps, the <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/snowflake-gave-up-its-dual-class-shares-should-you\/\">issues<\/a> with dual-class shares, the <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/olo-prices-ipo-sharply-above-its-target-valuing-company-as-high-as-4-6b\/\">recent IPO win<\/a> for the New York scene and <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/16\/the-global-inequity-in-venture-financing-is-staggering\/\">how unequal<\/a> the global venture capital market really is.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"veCncVawQc\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/16\/the-global-inequity-in-venture-financing-is-staggering\/\">The global inequity in venture financing is staggering<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;The global inequity in venture financing is staggering&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/16\/the-global-inequity-in-venture-financing-is-staggering\/embed\/#?secret=veCncVawQc\" data-secret=\"veCncVawQc\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>Closing, this <a href=\"https:\/\/bigtechnology.substack.com\/p\/the-soft-corruption-of-big-techs\">BigTechnology piece<\/a> was good, as was <a href=\"https:\/\/www.notboring.co\/p\/the-beginning-of-the-end\">this Not Boring essay<\/a>. Hugs, and have a lovely respite,<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/alex\">Alex<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Welcome back to The TechCrunch Exchange, a weekly startups-and-markets newsletter. Exchange","slug":"the-techcrunch-exchange","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576780724"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576780724"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576780724"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576780724"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576780724"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2127896,"date":"2021-03-20T12:23:18","date_gmt":"2021-03-20T19:23:18","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2127896"},"modified":"2021-03-20T12:23:18","modified_gmt":"2021-03-20T19:23:18","slug":"tim-cook-and-tim-sweeney-among-potential-witnesses-for-apple-epic-trial","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/20\/tim-cook-and-tim-sweeney-among-potential-witnesses-for-apple-epic-trial\/","title":{"rendered":"Tim Cook and Tim Sweeney among potential witnesses for Apple\/Epic trial"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">A proposed witness list filed by Apple for its upcoming trial against game-maker Epic reads like a who\u2019s who of executives from the two companies. The drawn out battle could well prove a watershed moment from mobile app payments.<\/p>\n<p>The two sides came to loggerheads when the Fortnite maker was kicked out of the <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/08\/28\/apple-terminates-epic-games\/\">App Store in August<\/a> of last year after adding an in-game payment system designed to bypass Apple\u2019s \u2013 along with Apple\u2019s cut of the profiles.<\/p>\n<p>Epic has accused Apple of monopolist practices pertaining to mobile payment. Apple, meanwhile, has argued that Epic broke the App Store agreement in order to increase its revenue.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>Filed late last night by the hardware giant, the document includes top executives from bot sides. For Apple, the list includes CEO Tim Cook, Software Engineering SVP Craig Federighi and Apple Fellow, Phil Schiller. On team Epic, it\u2019s Tim Sweeney and VP Mark Rein. Executives from Microsoft, Facebook and NVIDIA are also included, for good measure.<\/p>\n<p>In a statement provided to TechCrunch, Apple notes,<\/p>\n<blockquote><p>Our senior executives look forward to sharing with the court the very positive impact the App Store has had on innovation, economies across the world and the customer experience over the last 12 years. We feel confident the case will prove that Epic purposefully breached its agreement solely to increase its revenues, which is what resulted in their removal from the App Store. By doing that, Epic circumvented the security features of the App Store in a way that would lead to reduced competition and put consumers\u2019 privacy and data security at tremendous risk.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p>The trial is expected to kick off May 3. We&#8217;ve reached out to Epic for additional comment.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"6n5o3k2emO\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/11\/18\/epic-games-founder-tim-sweeney-likens-fight-against-apple-to-fight-for-civil-rights\/\">Epic Games founder Tim Sweeney likens fight against Apple to fight for civil rights<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Epic Games founder Tim Sweeney likens fight against Apple to fight for civil rights&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/11\/18\/epic-games-founder-tim-sweeney-likens-fight-against-apple-to-fight-for-civil-rights\/embed\/#?secret=6n5o3k2emO\" data-secret=\"6n5o3k2emO\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>A proposed witness list filed by Apple for its upcoming trial against game-maker Epic reads like a who\u2019s who of executives from the two companies. The drawn out battle could well prove a watershed moment from mobile app payments. The two sides came to loggerheads when the Fortnite maker was kicked out of the App Supreme, and soft-circling your way to an investment"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">In an <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/julia-collins-and-sarah-kunst-outline-how-to-build-a-fundraising-process\/\">Extra Crunch Live<\/a> this past week, Cleo Capital founding partner Sarah Kunst broke down what founders can learn from Supreme, a sought-after streetwear brand. She argued that founders, similar to Supreme, should build a brand around themselves that is so well-respected and has clout that whenever they start something new, investors will line up.<\/p>\n<p>\u201cA Supreme shirt that costs $100 bucks in the store will cost $1,000 online so, as an investor, I am just a kid on the street corner flipping sportswear,\u201d Kunst mentioned. &#8220;Who do I think is going to be an investment with such velocity that getting in early is going to be more than worth it as they grow.\u201d<\/p>\n<p>I think this is the best framing I\u2019ve seen about how to drum up excitement for a startup as a founder. FOMO isn\u2019t a strategy, it\u2019s a tactic. What really works, as Kunst alluded to, is when founders can point to key insights they\u2019ve had throughout their career beyond the context of a fundraising process. In other words, anyone can create a nice t-shirt and slap a logo on it. Which founder in this sector is going to give it meaning? It might be the one with the <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/edge-pathways-seed\/\">big former exit<\/a>, the one that was the first <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/julia-collins-and-sarah-kunst-outline-how-to-build-a-fundraising-process\/\">Black woman to ever build a unicorn<\/a>, or the one that <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/nigerias-termii-raises-1-4m-seed-led-by-future-africa-and-kepple-africa-ventures\/\">was on the ground facing the pain point they now want to solve. <\/a><\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>We get into <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/julia-collins-and-sarah-kunst-outline-how-to-build-a-fundraising-process\/\">how to build a fundraising process<\/a>, the concept of soft-circling an investor and what Kunst says is one of her biggest pet-peeves in a pitch deck on the site, but I wanted to give you that sneak peek for now.<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/pregame-y-combinator-with-equity\/?tpcc=ECTW2020\">Pregame Y Combinator Demo Day with Equity <\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/the-lightning-fast-series-a-that-was-3-years-in-the-making\/\">The lightning-fast Series A (that was 3 years in the making)<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a style=\"background-color: #ffffff; font-size: 1.125rem; letter-spacing: -0.1px;\" href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/hear-how-poshmark-went-from-series-a-to-the-public-markets-with-manish-chandra-and-mayfields-navin-chaddha\/\">Hear how Poshmark went from Series A to the public markets with Manish Chandra and Mayfield\u2019s Navin Chaddha<\/a><\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<h2><strong>Saying \u2018yes, please\u2019 to no code <\/strong><\/h2>\n<p>This week, <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/airtable-is-now-valued-at-5-77b-with-a-fresh-270-million-in-series-e-funding\/\">Airtable was valued at $5.77 billion <\/a>from a fresh Series E fundraise.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Here\u2019s what to know: <\/strong>As we discussed on Equity, Airtable is <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/forget-medicine-in-the-future-you-might-get-prescribed-apps\/\">far more than a savvy Excel sheet with bells and whistles<\/a>. It is one of the leaders in the no-code movement, and founder Howie Liu recently opened up its API to promote developer innovation atop its platform.<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\" https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/3-steps-to-ease-the-transition-to-a-no-code-company\/\">3 steps to ease the transition to a no-code company <\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/okay-the-gpt-3-hype-seems-pretty-reasonable\/\">Okay, the GPT-3 hype seems pretty reasonable<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/ai-fintech-products-are-operating-at-scale-and-investor-interest-is-maturing\/\">AI fintech products are operating at scale and investor interest is maturing<\/a><\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"I11ktqXFwQ\"><p><a Editor Jonathan Shieber, <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/16\/farmland-could-be-the-next-big-asset-class-modernized-by-marketplace-startups\/\">farmland could become the next big asset class <\/a>modernized by marketplace startups.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Here\u2019s what to know:<\/strong> One startup, AcreTrader, is trying to create a Robinhood for buying farmland, which I think is indicative of how lucrative some view a patch of land. CEO Carter Malloy thinks that while private equity often gets press for being in the land game, most land is owned by smaller ownership through families.<\/p>\n<p>\u201cOver the last few months, we\u2019ve consistently seen our offering sizes grow while our funding windows shrink, showcasing the fast-growing desire surrounding this resilient asset class,\u201d he said.<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li><a companies for its energy transition accelerator<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a like LA push proposals<\/a><\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<p>More places for investors to throw their money reminds me of two other stories for you to check out:<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li><a Weekly","slug":"startups-weekly","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576603287"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576603287"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576603287"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576603287"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576603287"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":576599087,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/supreme\/","name":"supreme","slug":"supreme","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576599087"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576599087"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576599087"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576599087"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576599087"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2127454,"date":"2021-03-20T07:45:46","date_gmt":"2021-03-20T14:45:46","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2127454"},"modified":"2021-03-19T15:45:24","modified_gmt":"2021-03-19T22:45:24","slug":"this-week-in-apps-google-play-slashes-commissions-apple-sued-over-scammy-apps-youtube-launches-a-tiktok-clone-in-the-us","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/20\/this-week-in-apps-google-play-slashes-commissions-apple-sued-over-scammy-apps-youtube-launches-a-tiktok-clone-in-the-us\/","title":{"rendered":"This Week in Apps: Google Play slashes commissions, Apple sued over scammy apps, YouTube launches a TikTok clone in the US"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Welcome back to This Week in\u00a0Apps,\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/this-week-in-apps\/\">the weekly TechCrunch series<\/a>\u00a0that recaps the latest in mobile OS news, mobile applications and the overall app economy.<\/p>\n<p>The app industry is as hot as ever, with\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/01\/13\/app-stores-saw-record-218-billion-downloads-in-2020-consumer-spend-of-143-billion\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">a record<\/a>\u00a0218 billion downloads and $143 billion in global consumer spend in 2020.<\/p>\n<p>Consumers last year also\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/01\/13\/app-stores-saw-record-218-billion-downloads-in-2020-consumer-spend-of-143-billion\/\">spent<\/a>\u00a03.5 trillion minutes using apps on Android devices alone. And in the U.S., app usage surged ahead of the time spent watching live TV. Currently, the average American watches 3.7 hours of live TV per day, but now spends four hours per day on their mobile devices.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>Apps aren\u2019t just a way to pass idle hours \u2014 they\u2019re also a big business. In 2019, mobile-first companies had a\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/01\/15\/app-stores-saw-record-204-billion-app-downloads-in-2019-consumer-spend-of-120-billion\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">combined<\/a> $544 billion valuation, 6.5x higher than those without a mobile focus. In 2020, investors<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/01\/13\/app-stores-saw-record-218-billion-downloads-in-2020-consumer-spend-of-143-billion\/\"> poured<\/a> \u00a0$73 billion in capital into mobile companies \u2014 a figure that\u2019s up 27% year-over-year.<\/p>\n<p>This week, there was a lot of headline-making app ecosystem news, including Google&#8217;s impactful decision to drop its Play Store commissions, an App Store lawsuit over scammy apps with fake ratings, battles over Apple&#8217;s App Tracking Transparency and the arrival of a notable new feature on YouTube &#8212; a TikTok rival called Shorts.<\/p>\n<p><strong>This Week in Apps will soon be a newsletter! Sign up here: <a href=\"http:\/\/techcrunch.com\/newsletters\">techcrunch.com\/newsletters<\/a><\/strong><\/p>\n<h1>Top Stories<\/h1>\n<h3>Developer sues Apple over lost revenue due to App Store scams<\/h3>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2123653\" style=\"width: 690px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2123653\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-large wp-image-2123653\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/apple-app-store-ios-2021.jpg?w=680\" alt=\"Apple app store iOS\" width=\"680\" height=\"382\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/apple-app-store-ios-2021.jpg 1180w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/apple-app-store-ios-2021.jpg?resize=150,84 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/apple-app-store-ios-2021.jpg?resize=300,169 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/apple-app-store-ios-2021.jpg?resize=768,432 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/apple-app-store-ios-2021.jpg?resize=680,382 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/apple-app-store-ios-2021.jpg?resize=50,28 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 680px) 100vw, 680px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2123653\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> TechCrunch<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>Kosta Eleftheriou, a co-founder of the Fleksy keyboard app, has been raising awareness about App Store scams in recent weeks, after his own app was targeted by copycat subscription scammers leveraging fake ratings and reviews to gain traction. This week, <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/fleksy-co-founder-is-suing-apple-over-lost-revenue-resulting-from-app-store-scammers\/\">Eleftheriou filed a lawsuit that attempts to hold Apple accountable<\/a> for his own app&#8217;s lost revenue, saying that Apple promises developers a safe and trustworthy marketplace, but then allows these scammers to operate to the detriment of legitimate apps like his own. Though some news articles positioned the case as some sort of antitrust lawsuit, it&#8217;s really more focused on scammers and the accountability Apple has for how its App Store operates, which apps are listed and how well it&#8217;s managed and policed. Eleftheriou is asking Apple to compensate him for his lost revenue and other damages as a result of Apple&#8217;s ill-run app marketplace, as well as what he claims are unfair App Review rejections.<\/p>\n<h3>Google Play drops commissions to 15% on some earnings<\/h3>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2004747\" style=\"width: 690px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2004747\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-large wp-image-2004747\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/mika-baumeister-QIpLrHJiv2o-unsplash.jpg?w=680\" alt=\"Google Play Store screen\" width=\"680\" height=\"438\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/mika-baumeister-QIpLrHJiv2o-unsplash.jpg 2400w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/mika-baumeister-QIpLrHJiv2o-unsplash.jpg?resize=150,97 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/mika-baumeister-QIpLrHJiv2o-unsplash.jpg?resize=300,193 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/mika-baumeister-QIpLrHJiv2o-unsplash.jpg?resize=768,494 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/mika-baumeister-QIpLrHJiv2o-unsplash.jpg?resize=680,438 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/mika-baumeister-QIpLrHJiv2o-unsplash.jpg?resize=1536,989 1536w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/mika-baumeister-QIpLrHJiv2o-unsplash.jpg?resize=2048,1318 2048w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/mika-baumeister-QIpLrHJiv2o-unsplash.jpg?resize=50,32 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 680px) 100vw, 680px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2004747\" class=\"wp-caption-text\">Google Play Store screen<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>Google has followed Apple&#8217;s lead in <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/16\/google-play-drops-commissions-to-15-from-30-following-apples-move-last-year\/?utm_source=feedburner&amp;utm_medium=feed&amp;utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Techcrunch+%28TechCrunch%29\">reducing commissions for the Google Play store<\/a>. But in its case, it has <a href=\"https:\/\/android-developers.googleblog.com\/2021\/03\/boosting-dev-success.html?utm_source=feedburner&amp;utm_medium=feed&amp;utm_campaign=Feed%3A+blogspot%2FhsDu+%28Android+Developers+Blog%29\">dropped<\/a> commissions from 30% to 15% on developers&#8217; first $1 million in revenue. Apple, by comparison, starts charging 30% once the developer tops $1 million. Google said 99% of developers who sell goods and services through the Play Store will see a 50% reduction in fees. According to App Annie data, very few Google Play developers make more than $1 million &#8212; in fact, only 2,035 developers do on Google Play, compared with 3,611 on iOS. To put this in perspective in terms of revenue, developers making up to $1 million in consumer spend only comprised 5% of total Google Play consumer spend in 2020, the firm noted.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"TSb1thekuH\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/16\/google-play-drops-commissions-to-15-from-30-following-apples-move-last-year\/\">Google Play drops commissions to 15% from 30%, following Apple&#8217;s move last year<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Google Play drops commissions to 15% from 30%, following Apple&#8217;s move last year&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/16\/google-play-drops-commissions-to-15-from-30-following-apples-move-last-year\/embed\/#?secret=TSb1thekuH\" data-secret=\"TSb1thekuH\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<h3>Apple&#8217;s ATT scores a win in France<\/h3>\n<p>Apple <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/frances-competition-authority-declines-to-block-apples-opt-in-consent-for-ios-app-tracking\/?utm_source=feedburner&amp;utm_medium=feed&amp;utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Techcrunch+%28TechCrunch%29\">fended off an attempt by advertisers in France<\/a> who wanted to derail the IDFA change in iOS, which will require users&#8217; permission in order to track them. The complaint had attempted to contrast Apple&#8217;s ATT (App Tracking Transparency) requirements for third parties with Apple&#8217;s own, where its first-party apps are allow to track by default for the purpose of personalizing ads in various Apple apps. France\u2019s competition regulator decided Apple&#8217;s plans &#8220;<a href=\"https:\/\/www.wsj.com\/articles\/apple-scores-legal-win-in-france-over-app-privacy-changes-11615971737?mod=djemalertNEWS\">don&#8217;t appear to be abusive<\/a>&#8221; and said it can&#8217;t intervene just because some apps may see a negative impact. But the authority did say it will investigate Apple further to determine if any of its changes are &#8220;self-preferencing.&#8221;<\/p>\n<h3>YouTube launches its TikTok rival in the U.S.<\/h3>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2126699\" style=\"width: 520px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2126699\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-large wp-image-2126699\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Player-3_4.png?w=510\" alt=\"\" width=\"510\" height=\"680\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Player-3_4.png 2166w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Player-3_4.png?resize=112,150 112w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Player-3_4.png?resize=225,300 225w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Player-3_4.png?resize=768,1024 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Player-3_4.png?resize=510,680 510w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Player-3_4.png?resize=1152,1536 1152w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Player-3_4.png?resize=1535,2048 1535w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Player-3_4.png?resize=37,50 37w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 510px) 100vw, 510px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2126699\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> YouTube<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>The short-form video experience known as YouTube Shorts first launched in India, where TikTok has been banned, in September. It&#8217;s <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/2126652\/\">now coming to the U.S. in its first major expansion<\/a>. The feature, still in beta, offers a very TikTok-like experience both in terms of recording content and viewing. Users can tap to record video segments for up to 60-second long videos, and use a small handful of editing features like text captions, countdown timers and speed controls. Meanwhile, viewing the videos is also presented in a TikTok-like format with vertical feeds of video where you can double-tap to like, duck into comments or tap on hashtags or sounds to participate in trends.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"gYqOf6BSe7\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/2126652\/\">YouTube&#8217;s TikTok rival, YouTube Shorts, arrives in the US<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;YouTube&#8217;s TikTok rival, YouTube Shorts, arrives in the US&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/2126652\/embed\/#?secret=gYqOf6BSe7\" data-secret=\"gYqOf6BSe7\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>YouTube believes the feature has potential because it&#8217;s connected to the larger YouTube ecosystem, including YouTube Music and the main platform itself &#8212; you can subscribe to YouTube channels right from Shorts, for example. But Shorts lacks a lot of what makes TikTok successful for the time being, like its numerous AR effects and editing tools, sound sync and its ability for creators to react and respond to other videos through stitches and duets.<\/p>\n<h1>Weekly News<\/h1>\n<h3>Platforms: Apple<\/h3>\n<p><strong>Apple <a href=\"https:\/\/9to5mac.com\/2021\/03\/16\/russia-pre-install-iphone-apple\/\">will allow<\/a> the Russian government to pre-install apps on the iPhone starting on April 1, 2021<\/strong>. In accordance with a new law, Apple users will be shown a dialog box at setup that prompts them to install web browsers, antivirus, messenger and email apps. Users can choose to deselect these apps or delete them from the device later.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Report claims Apple may soon deliver standalone iOS security updates<\/strong>. <a href=\"https:\/\/9to5mac.com\/2021\/03\/15\/ios-security-fixes-could-soon-be-delivered-separately-from-other-updates-beta-code-suggests\/\">According to code found in the latest iOS 14.5 beta,<\/a> Apple could be preparing to introduce a way to update older iPhones with critical security updates without requiring users to download new versions of iOS. This could be helpful in patching older devices where users don&#8217;t download iOS updates for fear of slowing down their phone.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Apple <a href=\"https:\/\/9to5mac.com\/2021\/03\/15\/app-store-data-european-countries\/?utm_source=feedburner&amp;utm_medium=feed&amp;utm_campaign=Feed%3A+9To5Mac-MacAllDay+%289+to+5+Mac+-+Apple+Intelligence%29\">says<\/a> the App Store now supports 300K jobs in <a href=\"https:\/\/www.apple.com\/uk\/newsroom\/2021\/03\/uk-ios-app-economy-has-a-breakthrough-year-grows-to-support-330000-jobs\/\">the U.K<\/a>., up 10% YoY, as well as 250K jobs in <a href=\"https:\/\/www.apple.com\/de\/newsroom\/2021\/03\/germanys-ios-app-economy-supports-more-than-a-quarter-of-a-million-jobs\/\">Germany<\/a> and another 250K in <a href=\"https:\/\/www.apple.com\/fr\/newsroom\/2021\/03\/frances-ios-app-economy-hits-milestone-supporting-over-a-quarter-million-jobs\/\">France<\/a>.<\/strong> The figures were released in response to increased antitrust scrutiny by regulators, as a way to demonstrate the App Store&#8217;s contribution to local economies.<\/p>\n<h3>Platforms: Google<\/h3>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2127053\" style=\"width: 639px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2127053\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-large wp-image-2127053\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-18-at-12.18.40-PM.jpg?w=629\" alt=\"\" width=\"629\" height=\"680\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> App Annie<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p><strong>App Annie data shows <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/data-shows-how-few-google-play-developers-will-pay-the-higher-30-commission-after-policy-change\/\">how few Google Play developers will pay<\/a> the higher 30% commission after the policy change, announced this week<\/strong>. Google says developers&#8217; first $1 million in revenue will be commissioned at 15%, not 30%. This covers the vast majority of the Play Store&#8217;s developer base, as <strong>only 2,035 developers<\/strong> make $1 million or more.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Google updates its People API, which will replace the Contacts API being deprecated on June 15, 2021.<\/strong> The new API will now support two new endpoints for batch mutates and Contacts searches, <a href=\"https:\/\/developers.googleblog.com\/2021\/03\/google-people-api-now-supports-batch.html?utm_source=feedburner&amp;utm_medium=feed&amp;utm_campaign=Feed%3A+GDBcode+%28Google+Developers+Blog%29\">the company said.<\/a><\/p>\n<p><strong>Google <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/16\/googles-family-link-updates-reflect-the-pandemics-impact-on-how-parents-view-screen-time\/\">updates<\/a> its parental controls for Android, Family Link.<\/strong> The updates acknowledge that not all screen time is the same, by allowing parents to set some apps &#8212; like those used for virtual school &#8212; as &#8220;always allowed&#8221; and not counting toward daily limits. It also updated reporting to better show where kids were spending time outside of these necessary apps.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Google is now <a href=\"https:\/\/android-developers.googleblog.com\/2021\/03\/creating-custom-tiles-on-wear-os-by-google-with-jetpack-tiles.html\">allowing<\/a> third-party developers to build Tiles for Wear OS smartwatches<\/strong>. Tiles are small, fast-loading experiences that can deliver specific, timely information users need, but can be tapped to open a related app on the watch or phone for a deeper experience.<\/p>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2127551\" style=\"width: 690px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2127551\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"wp-image-2127551 size-large\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Tiles_alpaha_layout2.png?w=680\" alt=\"\" width=\"680\" height=\"383\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Tiles_alpaha_layout2.png 1600w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Tiles_alpaha_layout2.png?resize=150,84 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Tiles_alpaha_layout2.png?resize=300,169 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Tiles_alpaha_layout2.png?resize=768,432 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Tiles_alpaha_layout2.png?resize=680,383 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Tiles_alpaha_layout2.png?resize=1536,864 1536w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Tiles_alpaha_layout2.png?resize=50,28 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 680px) 100vw, 680px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2127551\" class=\"wp-caption-text\">Image Credits: Google<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<h3>E-commerce<\/h3>\n<p>Facebook&#8217;s Mark Zuckerberg said his company has been preparing for the Apple IDFA changes by investing in more commerce products on its own platforms, like Facebook and Instagram Shops. In <a href=\"https:\/\/constine.substack.com\/p\/pressclub-with-mark-zuckerberg-daniel\">a Clubhouse session<\/a> on Thursday, he announced Facebook has 1 million active Shops which are used by 250 million people every month.<\/p>\n<h3>Social<\/h3>\n<p><strong>Twitter is testing a way for users to <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/twitter-begins-testing-a-way-to-watch-youtube-videos-from-the-home-timeline-on-ios\/\">watch YouTube videos from within the home timeline<\/a> directly on iOS devices<\/strong>, instead of being redirected to YouTube. Finally! The test was made possible through YouTube&#8217;s iFrame Player API, which Twitter gained access to.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"wRETErJHA1\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/twitter-begins-testing-a-way-to-watch-youtube-videos-from-the-home-timeline-on-ios\/\">Twitter begins testing a way to watch YouTube videos from the home timeline on iOS<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Twitter begins testing a way to watch YouTube videos from the home timeline on iOS&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/twitter-begins-testing-a-way-to-watch-youtube-videos-from-the-home-timeline-on-ios\/embed\/#?secret=wRETErJHA1\" data-secret=\"wRETErJHA1\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p><strong>TikTok will no longer allow users to opt out of personalized advertising starting on April 15th.<\/strong> The app <a href=\"https:\/\/www.vox.com\/recode\/22334086\/tiktok-privacy-policy-personalized-ads?scrolla=5eb6d68b7fedc32c19ef33b4\">alerted users to the change<\/a> via a notice that appeared on screen at launch. This means uses will see ads based on what they watch and engage with on TikTok.<\/p>\n<p><strong>TikTok may add a group chats feature sometime early this year,<\/strong> <a href=\"https:\/\/www.reuters.com\/article\/us-tiktok-messaging-exclusive-idUSKBN2B9182\">according to Reuters<\/a>. The feature is already a part of the Chinese version of the TikTok app, Douyin, and would make the app more social.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Instagram adds new teen safety tools as competition with TikTok heats up<\/strong>. TikTok has been making its app safer for teens and <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/16\/instagram-adds-new-teen-safety-tools-as-competition-with-tiktok-heats-up\/\">this week Instagram followed suit<\/a> &#8212; but instead of locking down teens accounts by default, it made it more difficult for adult predators to reach teens on Instagram, through a variety of alerts and blocking features.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Leaked recordings detail conservative donor Rebekah Mercer&#8217;s role at right-wing social app Parler<\/strong>, where she joined meetings to rally employees to fight against the shut down of free speech, and other matters, <a href=\"https:\/\/www.bloomberg.com\/news\/articles\/2021-03-16\/relaunched-parler-engaged-in-mercer-funded-war-over-free-speech\">Bloomberg reports.\u00a0<\/a><\/p>\n<p><strong>Facebook is preparing to add an age-gate to Instagram that would allow for a curated, and likely COPPA-compliant, under 13 experience<\/strong>, according to a report from <a href=\"https:\/\/www.buzzfeednews.com\/article\/ryanmac\/facebook-instagram-for-children-under-13\">BuzzFeed<\/a>. TikTok today does the same thing, following its FTC fines. Instagram could be doing the same to ward off any FTC investigation into underage use of its app as well as to better cater to the younger users who are already on Instagram today.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"i9SMaeHrRR\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/signal-is-down-in-china\/\">Rising encrypted app Signal is down in China<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Rising encrypted app Signal is down in China&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/signal-is-down-in-china\/embed\/#?secret=i9SMaeHrRR\" data-secret=\"i9SMaeHrRR\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<h3>Messaging<\/h3>\n<p><strong>China banned Signal.<\/strong> The encrypted messaging app <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/signal-is-down-in-china\/\">became unavailable on the mainland<\/a> on March 16, following a ban of the Signal website the day prior. The app had been one of the few Western social networks that was accessible in China without a VPN.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Telegram is working on an audio experience that allows users to create voice chats<\/strong> in Telegram Channels that you can join either with your personal profile or channel profile. The feature is in beta testing and no official announcement has been made.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"550\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">And Telegram is bringing voice chats for channels now.<br \/>Clubhouse is everywhere \ud83d\ude31 <a href=\"https:\/\/t.co\/u5cSB6VSCy\">https:\/\/t.co\/u5cSB6VSCy<\/a> <a href=\"https:\/\/t.co\/WspFNlZI11\">pic.twitter.com\/WspFNlZI11<\/a><\/p>\n<p>&mdash; WABetaInfo (@WABetaInfo) <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/WABetaInfo\/status\/1370816665458515970?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">March 13, 2021<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https:\/\/platform.twitter.com\/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"><\/script><\/div>\n<h3>Streaming &amp; Entertainment<\/h3>\n<p><strong>Clubhouse <a href=\"https:\/\/variety.com\/2021\/digital\/news\/fadia-kader-joins-clubhouse-1234931647\/\">hires Instagram alum<\/a> Fadia Kader as its new head of Media Partnerships and Creators<\/strong>. The hire follows that of OWN and Netflix alum Maya Watson to serve as head of Global Marketing, and points to an increased interest in establishing Clubhouse in the world of media. Kader&#8217;s background is in music and tech, having led music partnerships at Twitter, and having worked at Def Jam.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Clubhouse promises its accelerator participants either brand deals or $5,000 per month during its three-month program<\/strong>. The company <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/clubhouse-promises-its-accelerator-participants-either-brand-deals-or-5k-per-month-during-the-program\/\">plans to work with around 20 creators<\/a> to help them produce, book guests and promote their shows on the platform, as well as source brand deals.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"uFOg3RsAxL\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/clubhouse-promises-its-accelerator-participants-either-brand-deals-or-5k-per-month-during-the-program\/\">Clubhouse promises its accelerator participants either brand deals or $5K per month during the program<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Clubhouse promises its accelerator participants either brand deals or $5K per month during the program&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/clubhouse-promises-its-accelerator-participants-either-brand-deals-or-5k-per-month-during-the-program\/embed\/#?secret=uFOg3RsAxL\" data-secret=\"uFOg3RsAxL\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p><strong>Clubhouse is also <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/frances-privacy-watchdog-probes-clubhouse-after-complaint-and-petition\/?utm_source=feedburner&amp;utm_medium=feed&amp;utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Techcrunch+%28TechCrunch%29\">currently being investigated<\/a> by France&#8217;s privacy watchdo<\/strong>g, CNIL, in an attempt to determine whether or not GDPR will apply to the app and <a href=\"https:\/\/www.bloomberg.com\/news\/articles\/2021-03-17\/french-data-watchdog-cnil-opens-probe-into-clubhouse-app\">how it&#8217;s complying with EU rules<\/a>. Germany&#8217;s regulator last month was doing something similar, as it began looking into how the app was protecting the privacy of European users and their contacts.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"VLw3KuM0TJ\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/frances-privacy-watchdog-probes-clubhouse-after-complaint-and-petition\/\">France&#8217;s privacy watchdog probes Clubhouse after complaint and petition<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;France&#8217;s privacy watchdog probes Clubhouse after complaint and petition&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/frances-privacy-watchdog-probes-clubhouse-after-complaint-and-petition\/embed\/#?secret=VLw3KuM0TJ\" data-secret=\"VLw3KuM0TJ\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p><strong>Premium content, entertainment and streaming have helped drive up the prices of in-app purchases (IAPs).<\/strong> In 2020, the median price for IAPs among the top non-game apps was $5.99, up from $3.99 in 2017. The median price of subscription IAPs alone, meanwhile, has remained flat at $9.99 over the past four years, <a href=\"https:\/\/sensortower.com\/blog\/app-store-iap-median-price\">Sensor Tower found<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p><strong>AT&amp;T will <a href=\"https:\/\/www.cnbc.com\/2021\/03\/17\/att-will-count-hbo-max-toward-data-caps-blames-net-neutrality-law.html\">begin counting HBO Max streams<\/a> through the app against data limits<\/strong>. The company owns HBO via WarnerMedia and was previously exempting streams from data caps, but says a California net neutrality law will now no longer allow it to do so. AT&amp;T spoke out against a patchwork of state regulations for net neutrality, saying they will create roadblocks to pro-consumer solutions.<\/p>\n<h3>Gaming<\/h3>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2127753\" style=\"width: 690px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2127753\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-large wp-image-2127753\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/us-mobile-puzzle-game-spending-march-2020-february-2021.jpg?w=680\" alt=\"\" width=\"680\" height=\"408\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/us-mobile-puzzle-game-spending-march-2020-february-2021.jpg 1450w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/us-mobile-puzzle-game-spending-march-2020-february-2021.jpg?resize=150,90 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/us-mobile-puzzle-game-spending-march-2020-february-2021.jpg?resize=300,180 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/us-mobile-puzzle-game-spending-march-2020-february-2021.jpg?resize=768,461 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/us-mobile-puzzle-game-spending-march-2020-february-2021.jpg?resize=680,408 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/us-mobile-puzzle-game-spending-march-2020-february-2021.jpg?resize=50,30 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 680px) 100vw, 680px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2127753\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> Sensor Tower<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p><strong>U.S. mobile puzzle game spending jumped 30% YoY to $4.6 billion in 2020,<\/strong> per a Sensor Tower <a href=\"https:\/\/sensortower.com\/blog\/us-mobile-puzzle-4-point-6-billion-revenue\">report<\/a>. The pandemic likely contributed to the rise, with top game Candy Crush Saga pulling in $643 million following by Homescapes and Gardenscapes.<\/p>\n<h3>Health &amp; Fitness<\/h3>\n<p><strong>Apple Maps <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/apple-maps-updated-with-covid-19-vaccination-locations-in-the-u-s\/\">has been updated<\/a> with COVID-19 vaccine locations in the U.S.<\/strong> Apple is sourcing data from\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/vaccinefinder.org\/\">VaccineFinder<\/a>, an initiative led by Boston Children\u2019s Hospital, which is also one of the sources Google Maps is using. Apple is allowing healthcare providers, labs and other businesses to <a href=\"https:\/\/register.apple.com\/covid-19\/\">submit<\/a> their information about vaccine locations.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"HCxZmP87ZS\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/apple-maps-updated-with-covid-19-vaccination-locations-in-the-u-s\/\">Apple Maps updated with COVID-19 vaccination locations in the US<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Apple Maps updated with COVID-19 vaccination locations in the US&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/apple-maps-updated-with-covid-19-vaccination-locations-in-the-u-s\/embed\/#?secret=HCxZmP87ZS\" data-secret=\"HCxZmP87ZS\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p><strong>Facebook <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/facebook-to-label-all-covid-19-vaccine-posts-with-pointer-to-official-info\/\">will label all COVID-19 vaccine posts<\/a> with a pointer to official, authoritative sources of information across Facebook and Instagram<\/strong>. It also said it will reduce the distribution of content from users who repeatedly violated policies on vaccine misinformation or who shared debunked claims, as well as any claims that fact checkers say are &#8220;Missing Context.&#8221;<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"8CshVqead9\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/facebook-to-label-all-covid-19-vaccine-posts-with-pointer-to-official-info\/\">Facebook to label all COVID-19 vaccine posts with pointer to official info<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Facebook to label all COVID-19 vaccine posts with pointer to official info&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/facebook-to-label-all-covid-19-vaccine-posts-with-pointer-to-official-info\/embed\/#?secret=8CshVqead9\" data-secret=\"8CshVqead9\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<h3>Security &amp; Privacy<\/h3>\n<p><strong>Facebook <a href=\"https:\/\/about.fb.com\/news\/2021\/03\/expanding-support-for-security-keys-on-mobile-devices\/\">expands<\/a> support for security keys to mobile users<\/strong> on iOS and Android. The social network has supported the use of security keys, which generate encrypted, one-time security codes, for desktop users since 2017.<\/p>\n<p><strong>California <a href=\"https:\/\/gizmodo.com\/california-passes-new-regulation-banning-dark-patterns-1846482961\">passed new regulations<\/a> that ban so-called &#8220;dark patterns,&#8221; or designs used by websites and apps to frustrate or trick users into doing things they wouldn&#8217;t normally do<\/strong> &#8212; like subscribing to a service they didn&#8217;t want or opting-in to sharing their data with the company, for example.<\/p>\n<p><strong>An <a href=\"https:\/\/9to5mac.com\/2021\/03\/16\/iphone-app-privacy\/\">iPhone app privacy report<\/a> from cloud storage company pCloud showed how much personal data is being accessed by apps<\/strong>. The apps collecting the most data were Facebook and Instagram, while Klarna and Grubhub tied for second place, followed by Uber and Uber Eats.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Big tech, including Apple and Google, are ramping up their lobbying in U.S. state capitals<\/strong>, <a href=\"https:\/\/www.wsj.com\/articles\/why-the-next-big-tech-fights-are-in-state-capitals-11615714201?mod=djemalertNEWS\">reports The WSJ<\/a>, as a number of bills that could regulate their industries are arriving in state legislatures. One of these is an <a href=\"https:\/\/9to5mac.com\/2021\/03\/15\/apple-app-store-lobbying-bill\/?utm_source=feedburner&amp;utm_medium=feed&amp;utm_campaign=Feed%3A+9To5Mac-MacAllDay+%289+to+5+Mac+-+Apple+Intelligence%29\">app store payments bill<\/a> that is going to be debated in Arizona&#8217;s Senate in the next several weeks. If passed, developers would be able to use their own payment systems for in-app purchases instead of Apple&#8217;s and Google&#8217;s systems. Other legislation is being proposed in states including Maryland and Virginia.<\/p>\n<p><strong>A government-backed consortium of Chinese companies <a href=\"https:\/\/appleinsider.com\/articles\/21\/03\/16\/chinese-apps-test-bypass-for-apples-app-tracking-transparency\">introduced<\/a> a new method for tracking iPhone users as an alternative to IDFA<\/strong>\u00a0(paywalled source: <a href=\"https:\/\/www.ft.com\/content\/520ccdae-202f-45f9-a516-5cbe08361c34\">FT<\/a>). The system could be a workaround for Apple&#8217;s App Tracking Transparency, as it won&#8217;t require user permission. Tencent and ByteDance are reportedly testing the system, known as CAID.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Google finally rolls out iOS privacy labels for Chrome and Google Search.<\/strong> Competitor DuckDuckGo trolled the company for its delay, saying &#8220;after months of stalling, Google finally revealed how much personal data they collect in Chrome and the Google app. No wonder they wanted to hide it.&#8221; Burn!<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"550\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n<p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">After months of stalling, Google finally revealed how much personal data they collect in Chrome and the Google app. No wonder they wanted to hide it.<br \/>\u2070<br \/>Spying on users has nothing to do with building a great web browser or search engine. We would know (our app is both in one). <a href=\"https:\/\/t.co\/lJBbLTjMuu\">pic.twitter.com\/lJBbLTjMuu<\/a><\/p>\n<p>&mdash; DuckDuckGo (@DuckDuckGo) <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/DuckDuckGo\/status\/1371509053613084679?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">March 15, 2021<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https:\/\/platform.twitter.com\/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"><\/script><\/div>\n<h3>Business, Enterprise and Productivity<\/h3>\n<p><strong>App Annie <a href=\"https:\/\/www.appannie.com\/en\/insights\/product-announcements\/introducing-data-integration-solutions-for-mobile-insights-where-you-need-them\/\">partners<\/a> with Snowflake and introduces a new Salesforce integration<\/strong>. The former allow data teams to access and transform a variety of mobile estimates, both live and continually updated. The new App Annie Intelligence Salesforce Connector, meanwhile, lets App Annie customers build a better pipeline through mobile-metric enriched CRM records.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Google Meet <a href=\"https:\/\/androidcommunity.com\/google-meet-rolls-out-tile-view-on-ios-releases-guide-for-parents-20210316\/\">rolls out the tile view<\/a> on iOS, to be soon followed by Android support<\/strong>. This view allows a user to see more of the people on the video call, even on the small screen. The app also <a href=\"https:\/\/www.androidpolice.com\/2021\/03\/16\/google-meet-now-supports-live-captions-in-four-new-languages\/\">introduced<\/a> support for live captions in four new languages on mobile (French, German, Portuguese and Spanish, the latter for Spain and Latin America)<\/p>\n<h1>Funding and M&amp;A<\/h1>\n<p><strong>\ud83e\udd1d Snap <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/snap-is-taking-a-significant-step-into-fashion-e-commerce-with-its-acquisition-of-fit-analytics\/\">acquired<\/a> a Berlin-based clothing size recommendation engine Fit Analytics<\/strong> that helps online shoppers buy the right sized clothes. Deal terms were undisclosed. The acquisition will see over 100 Fit team members joining Snap as the company pushes into e-commerce.<\/p>\n<p><strong>\ud83d\udcb0 Riva Health <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/riva-health-wants-to-turn-your-smartphone-into-a-blood-pressure-monitor\/\">raised $15.5 million<\/a> in seed (!!) funding to turn your smartphone into a blood pressure monitor<\/strong>, in a round led by Menlo Ventures. The company is co-founded by scientist Tuhin Sinha and Siri and Viv (exited to Samsung) co-founder Dag Kittlaus. The system being developed would have users place their finger over the phone&#8217;s camera light, which would then flash, allowing the app to use the light to track the blood pressure reading.<\/p>\n<p><strong>\ud83d\udcb0 Mobile banking app Kuda <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/18\/kuda-raises-25m-more-led-by-valar-to-become-the-neobank-for-every-african-on-the-planet\/\">raised $25 million<\/a> led by Valar to become the neobank for all of Africa<\/strong>. The company today offers mobile-first banking services in Nigeria and has doubled its user base from its seed round to now 650,000.<\/p>\n<p><strong>\ud83d\udcb0 London-based mobile investing app Invstr <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/invstr-raises-20m\/\">raised $20 million<\/a><\/strong> to pair Robinhood-like commission-free stock trades with digital banking services and educational and learning tools. The app has over 1 million global users.<\/p>\n<p><strong>\ud83d\udcb0 Investing app Gatsby <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/gatsby-raises-millions-to-take-on-robinhood\/?utm_source=feedburner&amp;utm_medium=feed&amp;utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Techcrunch+%28TechCrunch%29\">raised<\/a> a $10 million Series A for its Robinhood competitor.<\/strong> The app is aimed at younger users, offering commission-free options and stock trading and is aiming to have more than 100K accounts by the end of the year.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"Ko4iKxgynM\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/gatsby-raises-millions-to-take-on-robinhood\/\">The great Gatsby raises millions to take on Robinhood<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;The great Gatsby raises millions to take on Robinhood&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/gatsby-raises-millions-to-take-on-robinhood\/embed\/#?secret=Ko4iKxgynM\" data-secret=\"Ko4iKxgynM\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p><strong>\ud83d\udcb0 Digitail&#8217;s app for veterinary surgery practices <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/17\/digitail-an-app-vets-and-their-customers-raises-2-5m-seed-round-led-by-byfounders\/\">raised $2.5 million<\/a> in seed funding,<\/strong> in a round led by <a href=\"https:\/\/byfounders.vc\/\">byFounders<\/a> and Gradient Ventures (Google\u2019s AI fund). The company currently has 2,000 vets in 16 countries using its services.<\/p>\n<p><strong>\ud83d\udcb0 Match Group <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/match-group-makes-seven-figure-investment-in-background-check-nonprofit-garbo\/\">makes a seven-figure investment<\/a> in background check nonprofit Garbo.<\/strong> The Tinder parent company plans to integrate its apps with Garbo&#8217;s tools, which alert users to background checks of concern to daters like assault or stalking charges, among other things.<\/p>\n<p><strong>\ud83d\udcc9 Telegram is <a href=\"https:\/\/www.wsj.com\/articles\/telegram-app-is-booming-but-needs-advertisersand-700-million-soon-11615806001?mod=djemalertNEWS\">selling more<\/a> than $1 billion in debt to investors to fund its operations and pay creditors<\/strong>, with the promises of discounted equity if the company later goes public. The messaging app owes its creditors around $700m by the end of April, The WSJ reported.<\/p>\n<h1>Downloads<\/h1>\n<h3>Swell<\/h3>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2127523\" style=\"width: 690px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2127523\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-large wp-image-2127523\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-15-at-2.42.23-PM-1.jpg?w=680\" alt=\"\" width=\"680\" height=\"475\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-15-at-2.42.23-PM-1.jpg 1390w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-15-at-2.42.23-PM-1.jpg?resize=150,105 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-15-at-2.42.23-PM-1.jpg?resize=300,210 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-15-at-2.42.23-PM-1.jpg?resize=768,536 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-15-at-2.42.23-PM-1.jpg?resize=680,475 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-15-at-2.42.23-PM-1.jpg?resize=50,35 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 680px) 100vw, 680px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2127523\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> Swell<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>A <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/swell-voice-launch\/\">new startup called Swell<\/a> has a different take on voice conversations than Clubhouse. Instead of real-time conversations, Swell users engage in asynchronous chats where one user posts an audio clip of up to five minutes in length that others can listen to and then respond to with their own recording. These mini-podcasts can be private chats or public conversations. <a href=\"https:\/\/swell.life\/\">Swell<\/a> is available as a free download on both <a href=\"https:\/\/apps.apple.com\/us\/app\/swell\/id1498360152?ls=1&amp;\">iOS<\/a> and <a href=\"https:\/\/play.google.com\/store\/apps\/details?id=life.swell.swellapp&amp;\">Android<\/a>.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"eRfG1L31PX\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/swell-voice-launch\/\">Swell launches its app for asynchronous voice conversations<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Swell launches its app for asynchronous voice conversations&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/swell-voice-launch\/embed\/#?secret=eRfG1L31PX\" data-secret=\"eRfG1L31PX\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<h3>1v1Me<\/h3>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2125008\" style=\"width: 690px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2125008\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-large wp-image-2125008\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/1v1me.jpg?w=680\" alt=\"\" width=\"680\" height=\"344\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/1v1me.jpg 2870w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/1v1me.jpg?resize=150,76 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/1v1me.jpg?resize=300,152 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/1v1me.jpg?resize=768,389 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/1v1me.jpg?resize=680,344 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/1v1me.jpg?resize=1536,777 1536w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/1v1me.jpg?resize=2048,1036 2048w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/1v1me.jpg?resize=50,25 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 680px) 100vw, 680px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2125008\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> <a href=\"https:\/\/www.1v1me.com\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">1v1Me <span class=\"screen-reader-text\">(opens in a new window)<\/span><\/a><\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/www.1v1me.com\/\">1v1Me<\/a> launches its app that <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/with-1v1me-anyone-can-gamble-on-their-ability-to-crush-an-opponent-in-player-vs-player-games\/\">lets anyone gamble on their ability<\/a> to win in a player versus player game. The iOS app is now available in an invite-only mode, with the first invites going to creators who play games like Call of Duty and Fortnite &#8212; the first games that will be supported on the betting platform. Users can sign up for early access on the company&#8217;s website for the time being, then stalk the company on <a href=\"http:\/\/www.twitter.com\/1v1me\">Twitter<\/a> for invites.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"3pIQkULcRc\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/with-1v1me-anyone-can-gamble-on-their-ability-to-crush-an-opponent-in-player-vs-player-games\/\">With 1v1Me, anyone can gamble on their ability to crush an opponent in player vs. player games<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;With 1v1Me, anyone can gamble on their ability to crush an opponent in player vs. player games&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/15\/with-1v1me-anyone-can-gamble-on-their-ability-to-crush-an-opponent-in-player-vs-player-games\/embed\/#?secret=3pIQkULcRc\" data-secret=\"3pIQkULcRc\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<h3>Half Lemons<\/h3>\n<p><span class=\"embed-youtube embed breakout embed--video\" style=\"text-align:center; display: block;\"><iframe class='youtube-player' width='640' height='360' src='https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/embed\/XQ8YIMfSfAY?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;fs=1&#038;hl=en-US&#038;autohide=2&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;' sandbox='allow-scripts allow-same-origin allow-popups allow-presentation'><\/iframe><\/span><\/p>\n<p>This clever iOS recipes app, <a href=\"https:\/\/www.halflemons.com\/\">Half Lemons<\/a>, does that thing you&#8217;ve always wanted a recipe app to do: it serves up dish ideas using the ingredients you have at home. To use the app, you take a quick digital inventory of your kitchen in order to customize the app to deliver recipes that are specifically tailored to your own ingredients. You can then save or share the recipes, in addition to making them right away with a screen that stays powered on as you cook. Future versions of the app will help you shop for ingredients and plan meals.<\/p>\n<h3><strong>Retrofy your iPhone<br \/>\n<\/strong><\/h3>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2127763\" style=\"width: 690px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2127763\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-large wp-image-2127763\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/iOS-Old-school-retro-iPhone-icon-set-close-up-top.gif?w=680\" alt=\"\" width=\"680\" height=\"382\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2127763\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> <a href=\"https:\/\/www.benvessey.com\/mac\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Ben Vessey <span class=\"screen-reader-text\">(opens in a new window)<\/span><\/a><\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>Bored with your iOS 14 customizations? Take your iPhone old-school with <a href=\"https:\/\/www.benvessey.com\/mac\">this super retro iOS 14 icon and wallpaper set<\/a> featuring over 110 Mac OS &#8217;84 icons and six monochromatic wallpapers. The set has been handcrafted by freelance digital product designer Ben Vessey, who many years ago had created a similar theme for &#8220;retrofying&#8221; your desktop screen. When he heard about the Shortcuts feature in iOS 14, he got to work to build a version of this retro experience for iPhone. The pack is \u00a33.99, or \u00a379.99 if you want to request five custom icons of your choice in addition.<\/p>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/this-week-in-apps\/\"><img loading=\"lazy\" class=\"aligncenter size-large wp-image-1952542\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/this-week-in-apps-banner2.png?w=680\" alt=\"\" width=\"680\" height=\"93\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/this-week-in-apps-banner2.png 2047w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/this-week-in-apps-banner2.png?resize=150,21 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/this-week-in-apps-banner2.png?resize=300,41 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/this-week-in-apps-banner2.png?resize=768,105 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/this-week-in-apps-banner2.png?resize=680,93 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/this-week-in-apps-banner2.png?resize=1536,210 1536w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/this-week-in-apps-banner2.png?resize=50,7 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 680px) 100vw, 680px\" \/><\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Welcome back to This Week in\u00a0Apps,\u00a0the weekly TechCrunch series\u00a0that recaps the latest in mobile OS news, mobile applications and the overall app economy. The app industry is as hot as ever, with\u00a0a record\u00a0218 billion downloads and $143 billion in global consumer spend in 2020. Consumers last year also\u00a0spent\u00a03.5 trillion minutes using apps on Android devices
