Browser","slug":"sidekick-browser","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576865358"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576865358"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576865358"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576865358"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576865358"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2126841,"date":"2021-03-19T12:00:55","date_gmt":"2021-03-19T19:00:55","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2126841"},"modified":"2021-03-19T12:23:21","modified_gmt":"2021-03-19T19:23:21","slug":"the-lightning-fast-series-a-that-was-3-years-in-the-making","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/the-lightning-fast-series-a-that-was-3-years-in-the-making\/","title":{"rendered":"The lightning-fast Series A (that was 3 years in the making)"},"content":{"rendered":"<div class=\"article__contributor-byline-wrapper\">\n<div class=\"article__contributor-byline\">\n\t<div class=\"contributor-byline__contributor\">\n\t\t<div class=\"byline__author\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"byline__author-name\">Nathan Beckord<\/span>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"byline__author-title\" style=\"display: block;\">Contributor<\/span>\n\t\t<\/div>\n\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"contributor__twitter\">\n\t\t\t<a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/foundersuite\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<svg class=\"icon icon--twitter icon--white\" viewBox=\"0 0 20 20\" version=\"1.1\" aria-labelledby=\"title\">\n\t\t<title>Share on Twitter<\/title>\n\t\t<path d=\"M20,4c-0.7,0.3-1.5,0.6-2.4,0.7c0.9-0.5,1.5-1.4,1.8-2.3c-0.8,0.5-1.7,0.8-2.6,1C16.1,2.5,15,2,13.8,2c-2.3,0-4.1,1.9-4.1,4.2c0,0.3,0,0.7,0.1,1C6.4,7,3.4,5.4,1.4,2.9C1,3.5,0.8,4.1,0.8,4.9c0,1.4,0.7,2.7,1.8,3.5C2,8.4,1.4,8.2,0.8,7.9v0.1c0,2,1.4,3.7,3.3,4.1c-0.4,0.1-0.7,0.2-1.1,0.2c-0.3,0-0.5,0-0.8-0.1c0.5,1.7,2,2.9,3.8,2.9c-1.4,1.1-3.2,2-5.1,2c-0.3,0-0.7,0-1-0.1c1.8,1.2,4,1.7,6.3,1.7c7.5,0,11.7-6.4,11.7-12V6.1C18.8,5.6,19.4,4.8,20,4z\"\/>\t<\/svg>\n\t\t\t\t<\/a>\n\t\t<\/div>\n\t\t\t<\/div>\n\n\t\t<div class=\"contributor-byline__bio\">\n\t\tNathan Beckord is CEO of <a href=\"http:\/\/foundersuite.com\/\">Foundersuite.com<\/a>, a software platform for raising capital and managing investors that has helped entrepreneurs raise over $2 billion since 2016. He is also the host of <a href=\"https:\/\/soundcloud.com\/user-2586856\/ep-121-how-i-raised-it-with-aydin-mirzaee-of-fellowapp\">Foundersuite\u2019s How I Raised It<\/a> podcast.\t<\/div>\n\t\n\t\t<div class=\"contributor-byline__more-articles\">\n\t\t<span class=\"more-articles-title\">More posts by this contributor<\/span>\n\t\t<ul class=\"more-articles-list\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/11\/23\/founders-seeking-their-first-check-need-a-fundraising-sales-funnel\/\">Founders seeking their first check need a fundraising sales funnel<\/a><\/li>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/09\/23\/fundraising-lessons-from-david-rogier-of-masterclass\/\">Fundraising lessons from David Rogier of MasterClass<\/a><\/li>\n\t\t\t\t\t<\/ul>\n\t<\/div>\n\t<\/div>\n<\/div><p id=\"speakable-summary\"><span class=\"featured__span-first-words\">Christine Tao runs<\/span><a href=\"https:\/\/www.soundingboardinc.com\/\"> Sounding Board<\/a>, a business founded in 2016 that offers executive coaching services to leaders at major companies like Kraft and Heinz. But not long ago, she was the one in need of a coach.<\/p>\n<p>But prior to that, Tao found herself in a new high-powered position at the mobile advertising company Tapjoy. Although she had plenty of sales experience, she was now working in an executive role leading the company&#8217;s entire sales staff. It was a tough learning curve. But the company&#8217;s board paired her with an executive coach, Lori Mazan, who ultimately helped Tao succeed.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;That really had a profound impact, not just on my professional development, but my personal development as well,&#8221; Tao said.<\/p>\n<p>\t<div class=\"article-block block--pullout block--left\">\n\t\t<blockquote>\n\t\t\tShow investors that you&#8217;re committed to following through. That makes all the difference.\t\t\t\t\t<\/blockquote>\n\t<\/div>\n\t<\/p>\n<p>Later on, Tao and Mazan teamed up to launch Sounding Board, a service with a proprietary algorithm that matches participants with coaches. Its capabilities-driven model can even measure the impact of the coaching.<\/p>\n<p>At the beginning, Tao didn&#8217;t have many resources. Ultimately, she raised $15 million in a pre-seed and Series A round. An impressive group of investors got in on the action, including<a href=\"https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/in\/roybahat\"> Roy Bahat of Bloomberg Beta<\/a>,<a href=\"https:\/\/precursorvc.com\/team_member\/charles-hudson\/\"> Charles Hudson of Precursor Ventures<\/a> and<a href=\"https:\/\/www.canaan.com\/team\/maha-ibrahim\"> Maha Ibrahim of Canaan<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>On<a href=\"https:\/\/blog.foundersuite.com\/how-i-raised-it-with-christine-tao-of-sounding-board\/\"> an episode of the \u201cHow I Raised It\u201d podcast<\/a>, Tao talked about raising money quickly, honing your strategy and getting back on your feet after all you hear is &#8220;no.&#8221;<\/p>\n<h2>Start out scrappy<\/h2>\n<p>From the very beginning, Tao had big ideas.<\/p>\n<p>She wanted to make coaching accessible to all sorts of executive leaders. The service wouldn&#8217;t just be for correcting bad behavior, as coaching had been in the past, but about helping executives grow and develop so that they could lead their businesses with their best foot forward. Tao also aimed to make coaching available through remote technology.<\/p>\n<p>The problem was, Tao didn&#8217;t quite have the resources to get started. Initially, turning those ideas into a functioning business seemed about as realistic as climbing Mount Everest.<\/p>\n<p><div class=\"extra-crunch-offer-container\"><\/div>","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>It took Christine Tao, founder of Sounding Board, just over three years to recognize the value of executive coaching and get her company to a Series A. Here&#8217;s how she did tactics","slug":"fundraising-tactics","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576668977"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576668977"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576668977"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576668977"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576668977"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":576608491,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/sounding-board\/","name":"Sounding Board","slug":"sounding-board","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576608491"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576608491"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576608491"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576608491"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576608491"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[{"id":576796353,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/extracrunch\/fundraising\/","name":"Fundraising","slug":"fundraising","taxonomy":"tc_ec_category","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category\/576796353"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/tc_ec_category"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tc_ec_category=576796353"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[]]}},{"id":2127491,"date":"2021-03-19T11:34:41","date_gmt":"2021-03-19T18:34:41","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2127491"},"modified":"2021-03-19T12:20:52","modified_gmt":"2021-03-19T19:20:52","slug":"superpedestrian-positions-itself-as-the-go-to-partner-for-cities-with-new-e-scooter-safety-upgrades","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/superpedestrian-positions-itself-as-the-go-to-partner-for-cities-with-new-e-scooter-safety-upgrades\/","title":{"rendered":"Superpedestrian positions itself as the go-to partner for cities with new e-scooter safety upgrades"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Superpedestrian, the startup that makes e-scooters equipped with self-diagnostic software, is upgrading its product as it prepares for a major expansion into 10 new cities within the next two weeks.<\/p>\n<p>Superpedestrian is considered an up-and-coming player in the micromobility world because of how it handles safety issues. The company has developed AI \u2014 which is integrated into the vehicle \u2014 that monitors and corrects scooter safety issues in real time. The next-generation operating system that will provide those upgrades, codenamed &#8220;Briggs,&#8221; will be uploaded to its global fleet of LINK e-scooters. It includes improvements to geofencing capabilities and battery life, making Superpedestrian more attractive to cities looking for partners who can provide assurances around safety and reliability.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;The scooter market has shifted in its short lifespan from a B2C to, in a lot of ways, more like a B2G [business-to-government],&#8221; said David Zipper, visiting fellow at the Taubman Center for State and Local Government at the Harvard Kennedy Center. &#8220;The trend has been for cities to reduce the number of concessions they grant to scooter operators, which puts more pressure on scooter operators to get one of those declining numbers of contracts available. You can&#8217;t really overstate how important it is, which technologies will rise and fall, and how companies position themselves.&#8221;<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Superpedestrian is one of the underdog e-scooter companies that are in the running for partnerships with cities like New York, which will soon be announcing the specifics of its <\/span><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/06\/24\/new-york-city-could-have-an-e-scooter-pilot-program-by-march\/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">e-scooter pilot program in the Bronx<\/span><\/a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. Micromobility giants like Bird, Lime and Voi have also placed bids.\u00a0<\/span><\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The company currently operates in cities across the U.S., including Seattle, Oakland, San Jose and San Diego, as well as European cities like Madrid and Rome.\u00a0<\/span><\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\u201cCities love our 100% compliance record,\u201d Ross Ringham, Superpedestrian&#8217;s EMEA director of communications, told TechCrunch. \u201cWe have never been censured, suspended nor expelled from any of our markets. We believe it is critical to work hand-in-hand with regulators to provide a successful service.\u201d<\/span><\/p>\n<p>City officials today are most concerned with complaints about scooters cluttering up sidewalks, so being able to clear the sidewalk or diagnose a broken scooter right away and summon someone to come and collect it would be an appealing value proposition for Superpedestrian, said Zipper.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"hh4ts4cjKe\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/19\/10-investors-predict-maas-on-demand-delivery-and-evs-will-dominate-the-post-covid-future-of-mobility\/\">10 investors predict MaaS, on-demand delivery and EVs will dominate mobility&#8217;s post-pandemic future<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;10 investors predict MaaS, on-demand delivery and EVs will dominate mobility&#8217;s post-pandemic future&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/19\/10-investors-predict-maas-on-demand-delivery-and-evs-will-dominate-the-post-covid-future-of-mobility\/embed\/#?secret=hh4ts4cjKe\" data-secret=\"hh4ts4cjKe\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The LINK scooters are powered by a Vehicle Intelligent Safety (VIS) system, which combines AI, 73 sensors and five microprocessors to run 1,000 vehicle health checks every second a ride is taking place. <\/span><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2019\/11\/19\/scooter-supplier-superpedestrian-raises-20-million-as-it-gears-up-to-launch\/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The software is constantly self-monitoring and self-correcting<\/span><\/a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, looking out for things like brake issues, battery cell temperature imbalances, cut internal wires and water penetration.\u00a0<\/span><\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\u201cVIS is as big a step-change in scooter safety as the seat belt was for cars, refined over four million miles of testing and service since 2013,\u201d said Ringham. &#8220;As a result, we\u2019ve had zero vehicle recalls or manufacturing defects globally.\u201d<\/span><\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The new update also includes 22% faster geofence reaction, three time more capacity for onboard geofences and sevenfold more precision when it comes to geofence accuracy. That means the scooter is able to better recognize a no-ride zone, and improve rider compliance by slowing down speeds and prohibiting riding or parking in certain areas.\u00a0<\/span><\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The fact that these computations are done in real time, locally on the scooter itself, accounts for the speed and accuracy of LINK\u2019s system, which reacts in as little as 0.7 seconds, and as few as 4.6 meters away from where a geofence-related issue was first detected. Other scooter companies tend to rely on cloud computing to calculate and enforce geofences, which can be too slow to stop riders from speeding through pedestrian areas or busy traffic.\u00a0<\/span><\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\u201cOur competitors typically buy off-the-shelf products and commonly use white label apps,\u201d said Ringham. \u201cWe do not outsource safety in this manner, meaning the information flows from our operations team and global fleets are used by our engineering teams to sustain continuous improvement.\u201d<\/span><\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Companies like Bird, Atom and Joyride offer white label operating systems that allow independent operators to launch their own rideshares and manage fleets, but not many players offer the type of safety-focused tech you see with LINK.<\/span><\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Detailed logs are also pulled by engineering teams to enhance performance with each updates, so the scooters get smarter over time, according to founder and CEO Assaf Biderman. <\/span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The aggregated and anonymized data collected from LINK\u2019s onboard software is also shared with city partners to help them design better infrastructure to support this emerging transport form.<\/span><\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\u201cIf a city partner comes to us with a new idea, we can easily add that, thanks to VIS,\u201d Biderman said in a statement. \u201cThis makes for constantly-improving vehicles for riders, better protection for pedestrians and more robust safety performance for cities. Cities should demand nothing less for their citizens.\u201d<\/span><\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"TAAkT01kQr\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2019\/11\/13\/micromobilitys-next-big-opportunities\/\">Micromobility&#8217;s next big opportunities<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Micromobility&#8217;s next big opportunities&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2019\/11\/13\/micromobilitys-next-big-opportunities\/embed\/#?secret=TAAkT01kQr\" data-secret=\"TAAkT01kQr\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Superpedestrian, the startup that makes e-scooters equipped with self-diagnostic software, is upgrading its product as it prepares for a major expansion into 10 new cities within the next two weeks. Superpedestrian is considered an up-and-coming player in the micromobility world because of how it handles safety issues. The company has developed AI \u2014 which is [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":133574434,"featured_media":2127495,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"outcome":"","status":"","crunchbase_tag":0,"amp_status":"","relegenceEntities":[],"relegenceSubjects":[],"carmot_uuid":"6fe77bad-c578-3f57-abd1-241c362e164a"},"categories":[2401],"tags":[576825356,1543531,2717,576638690,66411,576605516],"crunchbase_tag":[],"tc_stories_tax":[],"tc_ec_category":[],"tc_event":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Superpedestrian_LINK_March_2021_MY22_Briggs_2.jpg","shortlink":"https:\/\/tcrn.ch\/3cMgJlT","rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"premiumContent":false,"premiumCutoffPercent":1,"featured":false,"subtitle":"","seoTitle":"","seoDescription":"","tc_cb_mapping":[],"associatedEvent":null,"event":null,"authors":[133574434],"hide_featured_image":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2127491"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/post"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=2127491"}],"version-history":[{"count":11,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2127491\/revisions"}],"predecessor-version":[{"id":2127755,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2127491\/revisions\/2127755"}],"authors":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/133574434"}],"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/edit":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-admin\/post.php?post=2127491&action=edit"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/133574434"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/2127495"}],"wp:attachment":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media?parent=2127491"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories?post=2127491"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags?post=2127491"},{"taxonomy":"_tc_cb_tag_taxonomy","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/crunchbase_tag?post=2127491"},{"taxonomy":"tc_stories_tax","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_stories_tax?post=2127491"},{"taxonomy":"tc_ec_category","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category?post=2127491"},{"taxonomy":"tc_event","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_event?post=2127491"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]},"_embedded":{"authors":[{"id":133574434,"name":"Rebecca n\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576638690"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576638690"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576638690"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":66411,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/scooters\/","name":"Scooters","slug":"scooters","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/66411"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=66411"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=66411"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=66411"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=66411"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":576605516,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/superpedestrian\/","name":"Superpedestrian","slug":"superpedestrian","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576605516"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576605516"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576605516"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576605516"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576605516"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2126500,"date":"2021-03-19T11:24:20","date_gmt":"2021-03-19T18:24:20","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2126500"},"modified":"2021-03-19T11:24:20","modified_gmt":"2021-03-19T18:24:20","slug":"5-trends-in-the-boardrooms-of-high-growth-private-companies","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/5-trends-in-the-boardrooms-of-high-growth-private-companies\/","title":{"rendered":"5 trends in the boardrooms of high-growth private companies"},"content":{"rendered":"<div class=\"article__contributor-byline-wrapper\">\n<div class=\"article__contributor-byline\">\n\t<div class=\"contributor-byline__contributor\">\n\t\t<div class=\"byline__author\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"byline__author-name\">Ann Shepherd<\/span>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"byline__author-title\" style=\"display: block;\">Contributor<\/span>\n\t\t<\/div>\n\n\t\t\t<\/div>\n\n\t\t<div class=\"contributor-byline__bio\">\n\t\tAnn Shepherd is co-founder of social impact venture <a href=\"http:\/\/www.himforher.org\">Him For Her<\/a>. She serves on the board of fintech startup <a href=\"http:\/\/www.honeybook.com\">HoneyBook<\/a>.\t<\/div>\n\t\n\t\t<div class=\"contributor-byline__more-articles\">\n\t\t<span class=\"more-articles-title\">More posts by this contributor<\/span>\n\t\t<ul class=\"more-articles-list\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2019\/12\/11\/how-to-build-a-diverse-board\/\">How to build a diverse board<\/a><\/li>\n\t\t\t\t\t<\/ul>\n\t<\/div>\n\t<\/div>\n\n<div class=\"article__contributor-byline\">\n\t<div class=\"contributor-byline__contributor\">\n\t\t<div class=\"byline__author\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"byline__author-name\">Jocelyn Mangan<\/span>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"byline__author-title\" style=\"display: block;\">Contributor<\/span>\n\t\t<\/div>\n\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"contributor__twitter\">\n\t\t\t<a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/jcmangan?lang=en\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<svg class=\"icon icon--twitter icon--white\" viewBox=\"0 0 20 20\" version=\"1.1\" aria-labelledby=\"title\">\n\t\t<title>Share on Twitter<\/title>\n\t\t<path d=\"M20,4c-0.7,0.3-1.5,0.6-2.4,0.7c0.9-0.5,1.5-1.4,1.8-2.3c-0.8,0.5-1.7,0.8-2.6,1C16.1,2.5,15,2,13.8,2c-2.3,0-4.1,1.9-4.1,4.2c0,0.3,0,0.7,0.1,1C6.4,7,3.4,5.4,1.4,2.9C1,3.5,0.8,4.1,0.8,4.9c0,1.4,0.7,2.7,1.8,3.5C2,8.4,1.4,8.2,0.8,7.9v0.1c0,2,1.4,3.7,3.3,4.1c-0.4,0.1-0.7,0.2-1.1,0.2c-0.3,0-0.5,0-0.8-0.1c0.5,1.7,2,2.9,3.8,2.9c-1.4,1.1-3.2,2-5.1,2c-0.3,0-0.7,0-1-0.1c1.8,1.2,4,1.7,6.3,1.7c7.5,0,11.7-6.4,11.7-12V6.1C18.8,5.6,19.4,4.8,20,4z\"\/>\t<\/svg>\n\t\t\t\t<\/a>\n\t\t<\/div>\n\t\t\t<\/div>\n\n\t\t<div class=\"contributor-byline__bio\">\n\t\tJocelyn Mangan is the founder and CEO of social impact venture Him For Her. She serves on the boards of ChowNow and Papa John's.\t<\/div>\n\t\n\t<\/div>\n<\/div><p id=\"speakable-summary\">\u201cYour board will never be the same.\u201d<\/p>\n<p>With that prediction, Nigel Travis, board director and former CEO of Dunkin\u2019 and Papa John\u2019s, kicked off a recent discussion about the future of corporate governance with chief executives and current and aspiring board members.<\/p>\n<p>Just as countless aspects of corporate life have been reshaped over the course of the last year, boards of directors are undergoing significant and lasting transformation. Through our conversations with more than 500 business leaders and work on nearly 300 board searches over the last year, as well as findings from our recent board benchmarking study, we\u2019ve identified five trends in the boardrooms of the United States\u2019 high-growth private companies.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<h2><strong>1. Board diversity is imperative<\/strong><\/h2>\n<p>Historically, board members have been tapped from the personal networks of those already in the boardroom. This approach optimizes for trust and convenience at the expense of diversity.<\/p>\n<p>\t<div class=\"article-block block--pullout block--left\">\n\t\t<blockquote>\n\t\t\tWe expect to see continued improvement when it comes to racial and ethnic diversity in the years ahead.\t\t\t\t\t<\/blockquote>\n\t<\/div>\n\t<\/p>\n<p>As pressure to diversity the boardroom mounts and societal challenges underscore the risks of the all-male board, companies are starting to take a more inclusive approach to board design. They are reaching outside their networks to appoint women and people of color, discovering that it\u2019s not a pipeline problem &#8212; it\u2019s a network problem. In one year\u2019s time, the percentage of late-stage private companies with all-male boards declined from 60% to 49%.<\/p>\n<p>While that\u2019s progress, the fact that nearly half of the most heavily funded venture-backed companies lack a single woman on the board underscores the enormous work still to be done. Today, only 11% of high-growth private company board seats are held by women and only 3% by women of color.<\/p>\n<p>However, we expect to see continued improvement when it comes to racial and ethnic diversity in the years ahead. Demand for <a href=\"https:\/\/www.himforher.org\/\">Him For Her<\/a> referrals to female board candidates nearly quadrupled in that last quarter of 2020 compared with a year prior, and among the new directors appointed, a quarter identify as Black or African American.<\/p>\n<h2><strong>2. Source candidates from across the entire C-suite<\/strong><\/h2>\n<p>When seeking independent directors, boards have traditionally favored CEO experience. Given the gender imbalance among CEOs, preference for that title instantly tips the scales in favor of male candidates.<\/p>\n<p>As boards look to add women, many have discovered the value of taking a more strategic approach to defining criteria for the next director. Instead of relying on the CEO title as a proxy for the desired qualities, boards now conduct a gap analysis, identifying the mix of key competencies that would be most valuable.<\/p>\n<p>The result: a rich pipeline of executive operators who contribute strategic perspective combined with cutting-edge best practices. In addition to CFOs ready to chair an audit committee, we\u2019ve had requests for operators with go-to-market expertise, product leaders known for driving innovation, and people officers who know how to build corporate culture. We\u2019ve even helped companies seeking, for example, business-savvy doctors, nurses and law-enforcement officers to bring the voice of their customers into the boardroom.<\/p>\n<h2><strong>3. Independents come earlier<\/strong><\/h2>\n<p>As CEOs look to add diversity and operating expertise to their boards, many are adding independent directors at an earlier stage. How early? \u201cIt\u2019s never too early to have an independent director on the board,\u201d <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2019\/12\/11\/how-to-build-a-diverse-board\/\">according to Brad Garlinghouse, CEO of Ripple<\/a>, where the first independent was appointed only a year after the company\u2019s founding.<\/p>\n<p>Over the last year, the percentage of the heavily funded private companies with at least one independent director grew from 71% to 84%, and the percentage of board seats held by independents grew from 20% to 25%, according to the <a href=\"https:\/\/news.crunchbase.com\/news\/2020-diversity-study-on-private-company-boards\/\">2020 Study of Gender Diversity on Private Company Boards<\/a>. Among the board searches we\u2019ve conducted for privately held companies, more than 40% were Series B or earlier.<\/p>\n<h2><strong>4. The board Zoom is here to stay<\/strong><\/h2>\n<p>The pandemic drove boards onto screens, but even when health risks are mitigated, many will continue to convene virtually at least some of the time. The last year has caused companies to rethink the role of the physical office, and the importance of the physical boardroom is getting new scrutiny. Though most CEOs and directors will still favor in-person attendance for formal board meetings, we expect a new tolerance for remote participation and an increase in ad-hoc virtual meetings.<\/p>\n<p>Beyond reduced travel and ease of scheduling, there\u2019s a hidden benefit to virtual meetings that leaders would be wise to exploit: the reduced opportunity cost of more attendees. The impact of \u201canother body in the boardroom\u201d has long been an argument against allowing company executives to attend board meetings. We expect that, with a virtual format, CEOs will take advantage of the development opportunity to expose more of their leaders to board discussions.<\/p>\n<p>On the flip side, virtual meetings require a more conscious effort to build relationships. Boards will need to balance the convenience of virtual meetings with the value of in-person interactions in building rapport and fostering collaborative decision-making.<\/p>\n<h2><strong>5. Stakeholder capitalism takes root<\/strong><\/h2>\n<p>Propelled by increasing pressure in the public markets and by the growing number of consumers who make value-based purchasing decisions, private company boards will give sustainability more overt consideration in their decision-making. In his <a href=\"https:\/\/www.blackrock.com\/corporate\/investor-relations\/larry-fink-ceo-letter\">annual letter<\/a>, BlackRock CEO Larry Fink pointed to evidence of a \u201csustainability premium\u201d for companies that outperform their industry peers on ESG measures. As public companies standardize on <a href=\"https:\/\/www.businessinsider.com\/60-major-companies-agree-to-start-reporting-on-esg-metrics-2021-1\">metrics and disclosure around ESG performance<\/a>, that discipline will extend into the boardrooms of companies that aim to compete in the global marketplace.<\/p>\n<p>Private companies drive innovation in nearly every corner of the economy, yet their boardrooms have remained remarkably unchanged over the last several decades. We expect that 2020 will prove to be an inflection point in corporate boardrooms; this period of board transformation will be defined by increased diversity and inclusion and a growing emphasis on sustainable value creation. As these initiatives take root, beneficiaries will include not just the companies and their investors, but employees, customers, suppliers and society at large.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"pzA3yyRgPx\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/12\/30\/on-the-diversity-front-2020-may-prove-a-tipping-point\/\">On the diversity front, 2020 may prove a tipping point<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: over the course of the last year, boards of directors are undergoing significant and lasting diversity","slug":"gender-diversity","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/466222"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=466222"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=466222"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=466222"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=466222"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2127656,"date":"2021-03-19T10:53:24","date_gmt":"2021-03-19T17:53:24","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2127656"},"modified":"2021-03-19T11:54:10","modified_gmt":"2021-03-19T18:54:10","slug":"instagram-whatsapp-down","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/instagram-whatsapp-down\/","title":{"rendered":"Instagram and WhatsApp hit by outage"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Instagram and WhatsApp experienced an apparent outage on Friday. It began around 1:40 p.m. ET and lasted for more than half an hour.<\/p>\n<p>WhatsApp was unable to connect to the server, and messages were not being delivered. It&#8217;s not clear if the issue also affected Facebook Messenger, which <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/09\/30\/facebook-introduces-cross-app-communication-between-messenger-and-instagram-plus-other-features\/\">last year rolled out<\/a> new functionality to allow cross-platform messaging between Facebook, WhatsApp and Instagram.<\/p>\n<p>Instagram was showing a 500 message, suggesting a back-end server error.<\/p>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2127675\" style=\"width: 860px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2127675\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"wp-image-2127675\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-19-at-1.56.07-PM.jpg\" alt=\"Instagram's error page\" width=\"850\" height=\"577\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-19-at-1.56.07-PM.jpg 1290w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-19-at-1.56.07-PM.jpg?resize=150,102 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-19-at-1.56.07-PM.jpg?resize=300,204 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-19-at-1.56.07-PM.jpg?resize=768,522 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-19-at-1.56.07-PM.jpg?resize=680,462 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-19-at-1.56.07-PM.jpg?resize=50,34 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 850px) 100vw, 850px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2127675\" class=\"wp-caption-text\">Instagram&#8217;s error page. (Image: TechCrunch)<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2127685\" style=\"width: 790px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2127685\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"wp-image-2127685\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/img-whatsapp-1.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"780\" height=\"353\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/img-whatsapp-1.jpg 750w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/img-whatsapp-1.jpg?resize=150,68 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/img-whatsapp-1.jpg?resize=300,136 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/img-whatsapp-1.jpg?resize=680,307 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/img-whatsapp-1.jpg?resize=50,23 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 780px) 100vw, 780px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2127685\" class=\"wp-caption-text\">WhatsApp unable to connect to the server. (Image: TechCrunch)<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>WhatsApp has more than two billion users, and Instagram has about one billion users. Facebook&#8217;s developer status page did not show any immediate outages.<\/p>\n<p>Facebook spokesperson Leslie Grant said: &#8220;Earlier today, a technical issue caused people to have trouble accessing some Facebook services. We resolved this issue for everyone, and we apologize for any inconvenience.&#8221; The cause of the outage was not disclosed.<\/p>\n<p><strong>More on TechCrunch:<\/strong><\/p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/uber-under-pressure-over-facial-recognition-checks-for-drivers\/\">Uber under pressure over facial recognition checks for drivers<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/new-markets-emerge-for-carbon-accounting-businesses-as-cities-like-la-push-proposals\/\">New markets emerge for carbon accounting businesses as cities like LA push proposals<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/india-tells-court-to-block-whatsapps-policy-update-says-new-change-violates-laws\/\">India asks court to block WhatsApp\u2019s policy update, says new change violates laws<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/forget-medicine-in-the-future-you-might-get-prescribed-apps\/\">Forget medicine, in the future you might get prescribed apps<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/nigerias-termii-raises-1-4m-seed-led-by-future-africa-and-kepple-africa-ventures\/\">Nigeria\u2019s Termii raises $1.4M seed led by Future Africa and Kepple Africa Ventures<\/a><\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<p><em>Updated with comment from Facebook.<\/em><\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"8w8k8tv0kh\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/social-payments-why-fintechs-need-social-features\/\">Social+ payments: Why fintechs need social features<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; \/techcrunch.com\/tag\/instagram\/","name":"Instagram","slug":"instagram","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/42653521"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=42653521"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=42653521"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=42653521"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=42653521"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":25699058,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/whatsapp\/","name":"WhatsApp","slug":"whatsapp","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/25699058"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=25699058"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=25699058"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=25699058"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=25699058"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2126498,"date":"2021-03-19T10:43:06","date_gmt":"2021-03-19T17:43:06","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2126498"},"modified":"2021-03-19T10:43:06","modified_gmt":"2021-03-19T17:43:06","slug":"social-payments-why-fintechs-need-social-features","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/social-payments-why-fintechs-need-social-features\/","title":{"rendered":"Socia Kim<\/span>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"byline__author-title\" style=\"display: block;\">Contributor<\/span>\n\t\t<\/div>\n\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"contributor__twitter\">\n\t\t\t<a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/doshkim\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<svg class=\"icon icon--twitter icon--white\" viewBox=\"0 0 20 20\" version=\"1.1\" aria-labelledby=\"title\">\n\t\t<title>Share on Twitter<\/title>\n\t\t<path d=\"M20,4c-0.7,0.3-1.5,0.6-2.4,0.7c0.9-0.5,1.5-1.4,1.8-2.3c-0.8,0.5-1.7,0.8-2.6,1C16.1,2.5,15,2,13.8,2c-2.3,0-4.1,1.9-4.1,4.2c0,0.3,0,0.7,0.1,1C6.4,7,3.4,5.4,1.4,2.9C1,3.5,0.8,4.1,0.8,4.9c0,1.4,0.7,2.7,1.8,3.5C2,8.4,1.4,8.2,0.8,7.9v0.1c0,2,1.4,3.7,3.3,4.1c-0.4,0.1-0.7,0.2-1.1,0.2c-0.3,0-0.5,0-0.8-0.1c0.5,1.7,2,2.9,3.8,2.9c-1.4,1.1-3.2,2-5.1,2c-0.3,0-0.7,0-1-0.1c1.8,1.2,4,1.7,6.3,1.7c7.5,0,11.7-6.4,11.7-12V6.1C18.8,5.6,19.4,4.8,20,4z\"\/>\t<\/svg>\n\t\t\t\t<\/a>\n\t\t<\/div>\n\t\t\t<\/div>\n\n\t\t<div class=\"contributor-byline__bio\">\n\t\tJohn S. Kim is CEO of Sendbird, makers of a customizable chat and messaging API service for mobile and web applications.\t<\/div>\n\t\n\t<\/div>\n<\/div><p id=\"speakable-summary\"><span class=\"featured__span-first-words\">Social+ companies are<\/span> upping the stakes for everyone by giving consumers multiple benefits at once: products that serve a purpose but also meet our need for belonging to a community.<\/p>\n<p>But what exactly <em>is<\/em> a social+ company? One for which social engagement is an inextricable component of the product. That is to say: If you removed the social element, the product would cease to make sense. You can find plenty of examples in gaming (<a href=\"https:\/\/www.fastcompany.com\/90315238\/the-best-new-social-network-may-surprise-you\">Fortnite<\/a>), fitness (<a href=\"https:\/\/www.strava.com\/\">Strava<\/a>, <a href=\"https:\/\/www.onepeloton.com\/\">Peloton<\/a>), commerce (<a href=\"https:\/\/en.pinduoduo.com\/\">Pinduoduo<\/a>), audio (<a href=\"https:\/\/www.joinclubhouse.com\/\">Clubhouse<\/a>) and more. As noted in Andreessen Horowitz\u2019s recent series <a href=\"https:\/\/a16z.com\/social-strikes-back\">Social Strikes Back<\/a>, \u201cThe best version of every consumer product is the one that\u2019s intrinsically social.\u201d<\/p>\n<p>\t<div class=\"article-block block--pullout block--left\">\n\t\t<blockquote>\n\t\t\tSocial+ products are seeing mass adoption because they marry community with functionality.\t\t\t\t\t<\/blockquote>\n\t<\/div>\n\t<\/p>\n<h2>The benefits of a social+ company<\/h2>\n<p>Social+ products are seeing mass adoption because they marry community with functionality. Users form meaningful connections \u2014 and engage in value-adding conversations \u2014 within the context of the goal they\u2019re trying to achieve. Whether it\u2019s shopping for a deal or growing their assets, social+ products help users gain new knowledge, find motivation, garner status, form friendships and generally feel like they\u2019re part of something.<\/p>\n<p>Companies that base their business model on social+ products enjoy a variety of benefits:<\/p>\n<h3>Growth<\/h3>\n<p>When the social aspect of a product is integral to its function, users will often drive growth on their own steam, inviting their friends and family to join the community.<\/p>\n<p>Members of highly engaged communities are inspired and fired up by their interactions with other members, and when they\u2019re fired up about something, they talk about it. Participating in these communities makes users feel like they\u2019re part of something, which can have a powerful effect on your growth.<\/p>\n<h3>Retention<\/h3>\n<p>Relationships matter. The relationship your users have with your brand is ultimately what will determine whether they stick with you or leave you for a competitor offering the same service \u2014 particularly at a more attractive price. If you provide your customers with access to a community they relate to and resources that make their lives easier, they\u2019re more likely to be loyal.<\/p>\n<p>The beauty of social+ is that embedding social interaction within your product or app allows you to own that conversation and build a community around your brand. In the absence of built-in communities, these users are forced to turn to places like Reddit or WhatsApp to discuss, among other things, the relative advantages of competitors\u2019 apps.<\/p>\n<h3>Harnessing the creativity of your users<\/h3>\n<p>User-generated content (UGC) is the lifeblood of any social+ product, driving user engagement and fostering connections among users. UGC means the company can harness the creativity and popularity of its users and doesn\u2019t have to expend as many resources creating content users find valuable. Plus there\u2019s the added bonus that authentic UGC \u2014 whether it\u2019s a screenshot or a meme \u2014 lends the product far greater credibility than any marketing initiatives you could launch.<div class=\"extra-crunch-offer-container\"><\/div>","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>The shift toward social+ is not going anywhere, and the fintech vertical is no exception. The good news is the social+finance trend is still in its infancy, which means there are opportunities to gain a first-mover advantage by acting now.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":133574430,"featured_media":2126532,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"outcome":"","status":"","crunchbase_tag":0,"amp_status":"","relegenceEntities":[],"relegenceSubjects":[],"carmot_uuid":"b5787b1b-467b-33c2-8cdf-e370eaa16a03"},"categories":[25515,15835174,576597428,3457,17396],"tags":[4276,576846312,576851304,576848238,4269,1404273,87073],"crunchbase_tag":[],"tc_stories_tax":[],"tc_ec_category":[576796354],"tc_event":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-481570256.jpg","shortlink":"https:\/\/tcrn.ch\/2OHhDbv","rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"premiumContent":true,"premiumCutoffPercent":0.44,"featured":false,"subtitle":"","seoTitle":"","seoDescription":"","tc_cb_mapping":[],"associatedEvent":null,"event":null,"authors":[2126507],"hide_featured_image":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2126498"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/post"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=2126498"}],"version-history":[{"count":7,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2126498\/revisions"}],"predecessor-version":[{"id":2126626,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2126498\/revisions\/2126626"}],"authors":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/guest-authors\/john-s-kim"}],"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/edit":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-admin\/post.php?post=2126498&action=edit"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/133574430"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/2126532"}],"wp:attachment":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrun Applications","slug":"ec-consumer-applications","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576851304"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576851304"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576851304"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576851304"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576851304"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":576848238,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/ec-fintech\/","name":"EC Fintech","slug":"ec-fintech","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576848238"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576848238"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576848238"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576848238"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576848238"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":4269,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/finance\/","name":"finance","slug":"finance","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/4269"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=4269"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=4269"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=4269"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=4269"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":1404273,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/social-20\/","name":"social","slug":"social-20","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/1404273"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=1404273"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=1404273"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=1404273"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=1404273"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":87073,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/user-generated-content\/","name":"user generated content","slug":"user-generated-content","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/87073"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=87073"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=87073"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=87073"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=87073"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[{"id":576796354,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/extracrunch\/growth\/","name":"Growth","slug":"growth","taxonomy":"tc_ec_category","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category\/576796354"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/tc_ec_category"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tc_ec_category=576796354"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[]]}},{"id":2127426,"date":"2021-03-19T10:24:46","date_gmt":"2021-03-19T17:24:46","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2127426"},"modified":"2021-03-19T10:54:45","modified_gmt":"2021-03-19T17:54:45","slug":"uber-under-pressure-over-facial-recognition-checks-for-drivers","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/uber-under-pressure-over-facial-recognition-checks-for-drivers\/","title":{"rendered":"Uber under pressure over facial recognition checks for drivers"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Uber&#8217;s use of facial recognition technology for a driver identity system is being challenged in the U.K., where the App Drivers &amp; Couriers Union (ADCU) and Worker Info Exchange (WIE) have called for Microsoft to suspend the ride-hailing giant&#8217;s use of <a href=\"https:\/\/azure.microsoft.com\/en-us\/services\/cognitive-services\/face\/\">B2B facial recognition<\/a> after finding multiple cases where drivers were mis-identified and went on to have their licence to operate revoked by Transport for London (TfL).<\/p>\n<p>The union said it has identified seven cases of &#8220;failed facial recognition and other identity checks&#8221; leading to drivers losing their jobs and licence revocation action by TfL.<\/p>\n<p>When Uber launched the &#8220;Real Time ID Check&#8221; system in the U.K. in <a href=\"https:\/\/www.uber.com\/en-GB\/blog\/real-time-id-check-uk-drivers\/\">April 2020<\/a>, it said it would &#8220;verify that driver accounts aren\u2019t being used by anyone other than the licensed individuals who have undergone an Enhanced DBS check&#8221;. It said then that drivers could &#8220;choose whether their selfie is verified by photo-comparison software or by our human reviewers&#8221;.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>In one misidentification case the ADCU said the driver was dismissed from employment by Uber and his licence was revoked by TfL. The union adds that it was able to assist the member to establish his identity correctly, forcing Uber and TfL to reverse their decisions. But it highlights concerns over the accuracy of the Microsoft facial recognition technology &#8212; pointing out that the company <span style=\"font-size: 1.125rem; letter-spacing: -0.1px;\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.reuters.com\/article\/us-microsoft-facial-recognition-idUSKBN23I2T6\">suspended the sale of the system to U.S. police forces<\/a> in the wake of the Black Lives Matter protests of last summer. <\/span><\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 1.125rem; letter-spacing: -0.1px;\">Research has shown that facial recognition systems can have an especially high error rate when used to identify people of color &#8212; and the ADCU cites a <a href=\"http:\/\/proceedings.mlr.press\/v81\/buolamwini18a\/buolamwini18a.pdf\">2018 MIT study<\/a> that found Microsoft\u2019s system can have an error rate as high as 20% (accuracy was lowest for dark-skinned women).<\/span><\/p>\n<p>The union said it&#8217;s written to the mayor of London to demand that all TfL private-hire driver licence revocations based on Uber reports using evidence from its Hybrid Real Time Identification systems are immediately reviewed.<\/p>\n<p>Microsoft has been contacted for comment on the call for it to suspend Uber&#8217;s licence for its facial recognition tech.<\/p>\n<p>The ADCU said Uber rushed to implement a workforce electronic surveillance and identification system as part of a package of measures implemented to regain its license to operate in the U.K. capital.<\/p>\n<p>Back in <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/09\/22\/uber-loses-its-license-to-operate-in-london\/\">2017<\/a>, TfL made the shocking decision not to grant Uber a licence renewal &#8212; ratcheting up regulatory pressure on its processes and maintaining this hold in <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2019\/11\/25\/uber-has-again-been-denied-licence-renewal-in-london-over-safety-risks\/\">2019<\/a> when it again deemed Uber &#8220;not fit and proper&#8221; to hold a private hire vehicle licence.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"pLdS5APnPy\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/09\/28\/uber-wins-latest-london-licence-appeal\/\">Uber wins latest London licence appeal &#8212; but renewal is only for 18 months<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Uber wins latest London licence appeal &#8212; but renewal is only for 18 months&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/09\/28\/uber-wins-latest-london-licence-appeal\/embed\/#?secret=pLdS5APnPy\" data-secret=\"pLdS5APnPy\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>Safety and security failures were a key reason cited by TfL for withholding Uber&#8217;s licence renewal.<\/p>\n<p>Uber has challenged TfL&#8217;s decision in court and it won another appeal against the licence suspension <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/09\/28\/uber-wins-latest-london-licence-appeal\/\">last year<\/a> &#8212; but the renewal granted was for only 18 months (not the full five years). It also came with a <a href=\"https:\/\/content.tfl.gov.uk\/uber-licensing-appeal-licence-conditions-september-2020.pdf\">laundry list of conditions<\/a> &#8212; so Uber remains under acute pressure to meet TfL&#8217;s quality bar.<\/p>\n<p>Now, though, Labor activists are piling pressure on Uber from the other direction too &#8212; pointing out that no regulatory standard has been set around the workplace surveillance technology that the ADCU says TfL encouraged Uber to implement. No equalities impact assessment has even been carried out by TfL, it adds.<\/p>\n<p>WIE confirmed to TechCrunch that it&#8217;s filing a discrimination claim in the case of one driver, called Imran Raja, who was dismissed after Uber&#8217;s Real ID check &#8212; and had his licence revoked by TfL.<\/p>\n<p>His licence was subsequently restored &#8212; but only after the union challenged the action.<\/p>\n<p>A number of other Uber drivers who were also misidentified by Uber&#8217;s facial recognition checks will be appealing TfL&#8217;s revocation of their licences via the U.K. courts, per WIE.<\/p>\n<p>A spokeswoman for TfL told us it is not a condition of Uber&#8217;s licence renewal that it must implement facial recognition technology &#8212; only that Uber must have adequate safety systems in place.<\/p>\n<p>The relevant condition of its provisional licence on &#8220;driver identity&#8221; states:<\/p>\n<div class=\"page\" title=\"Page 6\">\n<div class=\"layoutArea\">\n<div class=\"column\">\n<blockquote><p>ULL shall maintain appropriate systems, processes and procedures to confirm that a driver using the app is an individual licensed by TfL and permitted by ULL to use the app.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<\/div>\n<\/div>\n<\/div>\n<p>We&#8217;ve also asked TfL and the U.K.&#8217;s Information Commissioner&#8217;s Office for a copy of the data protection impact assessment Uber says was carried before the Real-Time ID Check was launched &#8212; and will update this report if we get it.<\/p>\n<p>Uber, meanwhile, disputes the union&#8217;s assertion that its use of facial recognition technology for driver identity checks risks automating discrimination because it says it has a system of manual (human) review in place that&#8217;s intended to prevent failures.<\/p>\n<p>Albeit it accepts that that system clearly failed in the case of Raja &#8212; who only got his Uber account back (and an apology) after the union&#8217;s intervention.<\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 1.125rem; letter-spacing: -0.1px;\">Uber said its Real-Time ID system involves an automated &#8220;picture matching&#8221; check on a selfie that the driver must provide at the point of log in, with the system comparing that selfie with a (single) photo of them held on file.\u00a0<\/span><\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 1.125rem; letter-spacing: -0.1px;\">If there&#8217;s no machine match, the system sends the query to a three-person human review panel to conduct a manual check. Uber said checks will be sent to a second human panel if the first can&#8217;t agree.\u00a0<\/span><\/p>\n<p>In a statement the tech giant told us:<\/p>\n<blockquote>\n<p dir=\"ltr\">Our Real-Time ID Check is designed to protect the safety and security of everyone who uses the app by ensuring the correct driver or courier is using their account. The two situations raised do not reflect flawed technology &#8212; in fact one of the situations was a confirmed violation of our anti-fraud policies and the other was a human error.<\/p>\n<p dir=\"ltr\">&#8220;While no tech or process is perfect and there is always room for improvement, we believe the technology, combined with the thorough process in place to ensure a minimum of two manual human reviews prior to any decision to remove a driver, is fair and important for the safety of our platform.<\/p>\n<\/blockquote>\n<p>In two of the cases referred to by the ADCU, Uber said that in one instance a driver had shown a photo during the Real-Time ID Check instead of taking a selfie as required to carry out the live ID check &#8212; hence it argues it was not wrong for the ID check to have failed as the driver was not following the correct protocol.<\/p>\n<p>In the other instance Uber blamed human error on the part of its manual review team(s) who (twice) made an erroneous decision. It said the driver&#8217;s appearance had changed and its staff were unable to recognize the face of the (now bearded) man who sent the selfie as the same person in the clean-shaven photo Uber held on file.<\/p>\n<p>Uber was unable to provide details of what happened in the other five identity check failures referred to by the union.<\/p>\n<p>It also declined to specify the ethnicities of the seven drivers the union says were misidentified by its checks.<\/p>\n<p>Asked what measures it&#8217;s taking to prevent human errors leading to more misidentifications in the future, Uber declined to provide a response.<\/p>\n<p>Uber said it has a duty to notify TfL when a driver fails an ID check &#8212; a step that can lead to the regulator suspending the license, as happened in Raja&#8217;s case. So any biases in its identity check process clearly risk having disproportionate impacts on affected individuals&#8217; ability to work.<\/p>\n<p>WIE told us it knows of three TfL licence revocations that relate solely to facial recognition checks.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;We know of more [UberEats] couriers who have been deactivated but no further action since they are not licensed by TfL,&#8221; it noted.<\/p>\n<p>TechCrunch also asked Uber how many driver deactivations have been carried out and reported to TfL in which it cited facial recognition in its testimony to the regulator &#8212; but again the tech giant declined to answer our questions.<\/p>\n<p>WIE told us it has evidence that facial recognition checks are incorporated into geo-location-based deactivations Uber carries out.<\/p>\n<p>It said that in one case a driver who had their account revoked was given an explanation by Uber relating solely to location but TfL accidentally sent WIE Uber&#8217;s witness statement &#8212; which it said &#8220;included facial recognition evidence&#8221;.<\/p>\n<p>That suggests a wider role for facial recognition technology in Uber&#8217;s identity checks versus the one the ride-hailing giant gave us when explaining how its <span style=\"font-size: 1.125rem; letter-spacing: -0.1px;\">Real-Time ID system<\/span> works. (Again, Uber declined to answer follow-up questions about this or provide any other information beyond its on-the-record statement and related background points.)<\/p>\n<p>But even just focusing on Uber&#8217;s Real-Time ID system there&#8217;s the question of how much say Uber&#8217;s human review staff actually have in the face of machine suggestions combined with the weight of wider business imperatives (like an acute need to demonstrate regulatory compliance on the issue of safety).<\/p>\n<p>James Farrer, the founder of WIE, queries the quality of the human checks Uber has put in place as a backstop for facial recognition technology, which has a known discrimination problem.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;Is Uber just confecting legal plausible deniability of automated decision making or is there meaningful human intervention,&#8221; he told TechCrunch. &#8220;In all of these cases, the drivers were suspended and told the specialist team would be in touch with them. A week or so typically would go by and they would be permanently deactivated without ever speaking to anyone.&#8221;<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;There is research out there to show when facial recognition systems flag a mismatch humans have bias to confirm the machine. It takes a brave human being to override the machine. To do so would mean they would need to understand the machine, how it works, its limitations and have the confidence and management support to over rule the machine,&#8221; Farrer added. &#8220;Uber employees have the risk of Uber&#8217;s license to operate in London to consider on one hand and what&#8230; on the other? Drivers have no rights and there are in excess so expendable.&#8221;<\/p>\n<p>He also pointed out that Uber has previously said in court that it errs on the side of customer complaints rather than give the driver benefit of the doubt. &#8220;With that in mind can we really trust Uber to make a balanced decision with facial recognition?&#8221; he asked.<\/p>\n<p>Farrer further questioned why Uber and TfL don&#8217;t show drivers the evidence that&#8217;s being relied upon to deactivate their accounts &#8212; to given them a chance to challenge it via an appeal on the actual substance of the decision.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;IMHO this all comes down to tech governance,&#8221; he added. &#8220;I don&#8217;t doubt that Microsoft facial recognition is a powerful and mostly accurate tool. But the governance of this tech must be intelligent and responsible. Microsoft are smart enough themselves to acknowledge this as a limitation.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;The prospect of Uber pressured into surveillance tech as a price of keeping their licence&#8230; and a 94% BAME workforce with no worker rights protection from unfair dismissal is a recipe for disaster!&#8221;<\/p>\n<p>The latest pressure on Uber&#8217;s business processes follows hard on the heels of a major win for Farrer and other former Uber drivers and labor rights activists after <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/19\/uber-loses-gig-workers-rights-challenge-in-uk-supreme-court\/\">years of litigation<\/a> over the company&#8217;s bogus claim that drivers are &#8220;self employed&#8221;, rather than workers under U.K. law.<\/p>\n<p>On <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/16\/uber-says-it-will-treat-uk-drivers-as-workers-in-wake-of-supreme-court-ruling\/\">Tuesday<\/a> Uber responded to <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/19\/uber-loses-gig-workers-rights-challenge-in-uk-supreme-court\/\">last month&#8217;s Supreme Court quashing of its appeal<\/a> saying it would now treat drivers as workers in the market &#8212; expanding the benefits it provides.<\/p>\n<p>However, the litigants immediately pointed out that Uber&#8217;s &#8220;deal&#8221; ignored the Supreme Court&#8217;s assertion that working time should be calculated when a driver logs onto the Uber app. Instead Uber said it would calculate working time entitlements when a driver accepts a job &#8212; meaning it&#8217;s still trying to avoid paying drivers for time spent waiting for a fare.<\/p>\n<p>The ADCU therefore estimates that Uber&#8217;s &#8220;offer&#8221; underpays drivers by between 40%-50% of what they are legally entitled to &#8212; and has said it will continue its legal fight to get a fair deal for Uber drivers.<\/p>\n<p>At an EU level, where regional lawmakers are looking at how to improve conditions for gig workers, the tech giant is now pushing for an employment law carve out for platform work &#8212; and has been <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/17\/uber-could-give-gig-workers-a-better-deal-but-its-lobbying-eu-to-lower-standards-says-fairwork\/\">accused of trying to lower legal standards for workers<\/a>.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"ejqJHPS7eE\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/12\/30\/understanding-europes-big-push-to-rewrite-the-digital-rulebook\/\">Understanding Europe&#8217;s big push to rewrite the digital rulebook<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Understanding Europe&#8217;s big push to rewrite the digital rulebook&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/12\/30\/understanding-europes-big-push-to-rewrite-the-digital-rulebook\/embed\/#?secret=ejqJHPS7eE\" data-secret=\"ejqJHPS7eE\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>In additional<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/dutch-court-rejects-uber-drivers-robo-firing-charge-but-tells-ola-to-explain-algo-deductions\/\">\u00a0Uber-related news<\/a> this month, a court in the Netherlands ordered the company to hand over more of the data it holds on drivers, following another ADCU+WIE challenge. Although the court rejected the majority of the drivers&#8217; requests for more data. But notably it did not object to drivers seeking to use data rights established under EU law to obtain information collectively to further their ability to collectively bargain against a platform &#8212; paving the way for more (and more carefully worded) challenges as Farrer spins up his data trust for workers.<\/p>\n<p>The applicants also sought to probe Uber&#8217;s use of algorithms for fraud-based driver terminations under an article of EU data protection law that provides for a right not to be subject to solely automated decisions in instances where there is a legal or significant effect. In that case the court accepted Uber&#8217;s explanation at face value that fraud-related terminations had been investigated by a human team &#8212; and that the decisions to terminate involved meaningful human decisions.<\/p>\n<p>But the issue of meaningful human invention\/oversight of platforms&#8217; algorithmic suggestions\/decisions is shaping up to be a key battleground in the fight to regulate the human impacts of and societal imbalances flowing from powerful platforms which have both god-like view of users&#8217; data and an allergy to complete transparency.<\/p>\n<p>The latest challenge to Uber&#8217;s use of facial recognition-linked terminations shows that interrogation of the limits and legality of its automated decisions is far from over &#8212; really, this work is just getting started.<\/p>\n<p>Uber&#8217;s use of geolocation for driver suspensions is also facing legal challenge.<\/p>\n<p>While pan-EU legislation now being negotiated by the bloc&#8217;s institutions also aims to <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/12\/30\/understanding-europes-big-push-to-rewrite-the-digital-rulebook\/\">increase platform transparency requirements<\/a> &#8212; with the prospect of added layers of regulatory oversight and even algorithmic audits coming down the pipe for platforms in the near future.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/dutch-court-rejects-uber-drivers-robo-firing-charge-but-tells-ola-to-explain-algo-deductions\/\">Last week<\/a> the same Amsterdam court that ruled on the Uber cases also ordered India-based ride-hailing company Ola to disclose data about its facial-recognition-based &#8220;Guardian&#8221; system &#8212; aka its equivalent to Uber&#8217;s Real-Time ID system. The court said Ola must provide applicants with a wider range of data than it currently does &#8212; including disclosing a &#8220;fraud probability profile&#8221; it maintains on drivers and data within a &#8220;Guardian&#8221; surveillance system it operates.<\/p>\n<p>Farrer says he&#8217;s thus confident that workers will get transparency &#8212; &#8220;one way or another&#8221;. And after years fighting Uber through U.K. courts over its treatment of workers his tenacity in pursuit of rebalancing platform power cannot be in doubt.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"c8jYA6N5Pu\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/dutch-court-rejects-uber-drivers-robo-firing-charge-but-tells-ola-to-explain-algo-deductions\/\">Dutch court rejects Uber drivers&#8217; &#8216;robo-firing&#8217; charge but tells Ola to explain algo-deductions<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Dutch court rejects Uber drivers&#8217; &#8216;robo-firing&#8217; charge but tells Ola to explain algo-deductions&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/dutch-court-rejects-uber-drivers-robo-firing-charge-but-tells-ola-to-explain-algo-deductions\/embed\/#?secret=c8jYA6N5Pu\" data-secret=\"c8jYA6N5Pu\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"i8HPM6JJRo\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/16\/uber-says-it-will-treat-uk-drivers-as-workers-in-wake-of-supreme-court-ruling\/\">Uber says it will treat UK drivers as workers in wake of Supreme Court ruling<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\"
