infrastructure spending passed on-prem data centers in 2020"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">There is a prevailing notion that while the cloud infrastructure market is growing fast, the vast majority of workloads remain on premises. While that could be true, <a href=\"https:\/\/www.srgresearch.com\/articles\/2020-the-year-that-cloud-service-revenues-finally-dwarfed-enterprise-spending-on-data-centers\">new research from Synergy Research Group<\/a> found that cloud infrastructure spending surpassed on-prem spending for the first time in 2020 &#8212; and did so by a wide margin.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;New data from Synergy Research Group shows that enterprise spending on cloud infrastructure services continued to ramp up aggressively in 2020, growing by 35% to reach almost $130 billion. Meanwhile enterprise spending on data center hardware and software dropped by 6% to under $90 billion,&#8221; the firm said in a statement.<\/p>\n<p>While the numbers have been trending toward the cloud for a decade, the spending favored on-prem software until last year when the two numbers pulled even, according to Synergy data. John Dinsdale, chief analyst and research director at Synergy says that this new data shows that CIOs have shifted their spending to the cloud in 2020.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>&#8220;Where the rubber meets the road is what are companies spending their money on, and that is what we are covering here. Quite clearly CIOs are choosing to spend a lot more money on cloud services and are severely crimping their spend on on-prem (or collocated) data center assets,&#8221; Dinsdale told me.<\/p>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2127540\" style=\"width: 690px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2127540\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"wp-image-2127540 size-large\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Ent-Spending-2020.jpg?w=680\" alt=\"Chart comparing on prem spending to cloud infrastructure spending from Synergy Research.\" width=\"680\" height=\"433\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Ent-Spending-2020.jpg 1207w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Ent-Spending-2020.jpg?resize=150,96 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Ent-Spending-2020.jpg?resize=300,191 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Ent-Spending-2020.jpg?resize=768,489 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Ent-Spending-2020.jpg?resize=680,433 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Ent-Spending-2020.jpg?resize=50,32 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 680px) 100vw, 680px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2127540\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> Synergy Research Group<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>The total for on-prem spending includes servers, storage, networking, security and related software required to run the hardware. &#8220;The software pieces included in this data is mainly server OS and virtualization software. Comparing SaaS with on-prem business apps software is a whole other story,&#8221; Dinsdale said.<\/p>\n<p>As we see on-prem\/cloud numbers diverging in this way, it&#8217;s worth asking how these numbers compare to <a href=\"https:\/\/www.gartner.com\/en\/newsroom\/press-releases\/2020-10-20-gartner-says-worldwide-it-spending-to-grow-4-percent-in-2021\">research from Gartner<\/a> and others that the cloud remains a relatively small percentage of global IT spend. As workloads move back and forth in today&#8217;s hybrid world, Dinsdale says that makes it difficult to quantify where it lives at any given moment.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"b0SxBXQ30t\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/10\/22\/customer-experience-and-digital-transformation-concepts-are-merging-during-the-pandemic\/\">Customer experience and digital transformation concepts are merging during the pandemic<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Customer experience and digital transformation concepts are merging during the pandemic&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/10\/22\/customer-experience-and-digital-transformation-concepts-are-merging-during-the-pandemic\/embed\/#?secret=b0SxBXQ30t\" data-secret=\"b0SxBXQ30t\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>&#8220;I\u2019ve seen plenty of comments about only a small percentage of workloads running on public clouds. That may or may not be true (and I tend more toward the latter), but the problem I have with this is that the concept of &#8216;workloads&#8217; is such a fungible issue, especially when you try to quantify it,&#8221; he said.<\/p>\n<p>It&#8217;s worth noting that the pandemic has led to companies moving to the cloud much faster than they might have without a forcing event, but Dinsdale says that the trend has been moving this way over years, even if COVID might have accelerated it.<\/p>\n<p>Whatever numbers you choose to look at, it&#8217;s clear that the cloud infrastructure market is growing much faster now than its on-premises counterpart, and this new data from Synergy shows that CIOs are beginning to place their bets on the cloud.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"esnAc9eQQV\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/04\/the-cloud-infrastructure-market-hit-129b-in-2020\/\">The cloud infrastructure market hit $129B in 2020<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;The cloud infrastructure market hit $129B in 2020&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/04\/the-cloud-infrastructure-market-hit-129b-in-2020\/embed\/#?secret=esnAc9eQQV\" data-secret=\"esnAc9eQQV\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>There is a prevailing notion that while the cloud infrastructure market is growing fast, the vast majority of workloads remain on premises. While that could be true, new research from Synergy Research Group found that cloud infrastructure spending surpassed on-prem spending for the first time in 2020 &#8212; and did so by a wide margin. Research","slug":"synergy-research","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576596527"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576596527"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576596527"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576596527"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576596527"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2123733,"date":"2021-03-19T09:55:26","date_gmt":"2021-03-19T16:55:26","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2123733"},"modified":"2021-03-19T10:25:46","modified_gmt":"2021-03-19T17:25:46","slug":"attend-disrupt-2021-for-less-than-100","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/19\/attend-disrupt-2021-for-less-than-100\/","title":{"rendered":"Attend Disrupt 2021 for less than $100"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">If three jam-packed days of TechCrunch <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-disrupt-2021\">Disrupt 2021<\/a>, the mother of all tech conferences that takes place on September 21-23, wasn\u2019t enough to get your startup motor running, listen up. You can attend the all-virtual <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-disrupt-2021\">TC Disrupt 2021<\/a> for less than a $100. Your eyes do not deceive. Read on!<\/p>\n<p>Right now, super early-bird pricing is in play for Founder, Innovator and Investor passes \u2014 and every single one sells for less than $100. But this largess won\u2019t last. <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-disrupt-2021\/tickets\/\">Buy your pass to Disrupt 2021<\/a> before the super early-bird deadline expires on <strong>May 13, 11:59 pm (PST)<\/strong>.<\/p>\n<p>Let\u2019s talk about what Disrupt offers this year. In a word, plenty. In more words, opportunity, connection, networking, competition and a whole lot of experts downloading their knowledge to help you achieve your startup dreams.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>Networking is a huge part of Disrupt, and you\u2019ll find multiple ways to make valuable connections. Whether they happen spontaneously in our virtual event platform (the chat is where it\u2019s at!) or curated meetups through CrunchMatch, our AI-powered platform, you\u2019ll meet smart, exciting people eager to share, collaborate and inspire.<\/p>\n<p>You\u2019ll hear from and engage with marquee speakers from the Disrupt Stage \u2014 stay ahead of the trends, learn how others overcame struggles you\u2019re facing and gain insight from expert analysis.<\/p>\n<p>Get your how-to on over at the Extra Crunch Stage where you engage in interactive sessions and get you\u2019re your burning questions answered on the spot. Take advantage of pitch deck teardowns or explore other expert-led sessions for actionable tips to help you better define your business and build a stronger startup.<\/p>\n<p>Join the Extra Crunch bunch. Disrupt passes include a free 3-month membership to Extra Crunch. We\u2019re talking exclusive content like IPO analysis, expert how-tos on monetization, strategy and growth and investor surveys. Boom, value added.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-disrupt-2021\/startup-alley\/\">Startup Alley<\/a> is back this year with new exposure opportunities for exhibitors \u2014 including a chance to participate in the elite <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-disrupt-2021\/startup-alley\/\">StartupAlley+<\/a>. <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-disrupt-2021\/tickets\/\">Buy a Startup Alley Pass<\/a> and shine the influential Disrupt spotlight on your amazing company.<\/p>\n<p>This year, we\u2019re opening <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/startup-battlefield\/\">Startup Battlefield<\/a> to even more early-stage founders. With five semi-final rounds, it\u2019ll be our biggest, most exciting Startup Battlefield ever! Think you\u2019ve got what it takes to claim the title and the $100,000 prize? Applications for Startup Battlefield will open Q2 2021.<\/p>\n<p>Okay, we listed lots of reasons to attend Disrupt. Now hear why one of your own thinks Disrupt is an essential part of startup life.<\/p>\n<blockquote><p>\u201cDisrupt is laser focused on startups. I\u2019m just starting my own company and attending Disrupt was an incredible opportunity to connect with companies and learn from the best people in the industry.\u201d \u2014 Anirudh Murali, co-founder and CEO, Economize.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p>Don\u2019t miss your chance to attend Disrupt 2021 for less than $100. <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-disrupt-2021\/tickets\/\">Buy your pass<\/a> before that super early bird price expires on May 13 at 11:59 pm (PST). Batman wouldn\u2019t spend more than a Benjamin.<\/p>\n<p><em>Is your company interested in sponsoring or exhibiting at Disrupt 2021? Today, it has a market cap north of $5 billion. Mayfield's Navin Chaddha led the company's Series A all the way back in 2011, back when Poshmark was called Gosh Posh. Hear Chaddha and Poshmark founder Manish Chandra discuss a decade of growth, and walk us through how they came together more than ten years ago. Then the duo will take a look at pitch decks submitted by audience members.<\/p><p><a class=\"button button--green-gradient button--primary\" There are limited speaking sessions available but we always appreciate recommendations that align with our content agenda.\n<br>\n<a class=\"button button--green-gradient button--primary\" href=\"https:\/\/oathtechevents.typeform.com\/to\/REH3ByGV\">Submit Application<\/a>","title":"Apply to speak","type":"text","uid":"cdafbfc2-6d43-4951-aa9b-5fae6ff38784","panels_info":{"class":"TC\\Page_Builder\\TinyMCE\\Widget","raw":false,"grid":0,"cell":0,"id":9,"style":{"background_image_attachment":false,"background_display":"tile"}},"backgroundImageURL":null,"nav_title":"","display":true}],"pages":[]},"speakers":[{"bio":"<p>Clara is co-founder and Managing Partner of the Urban Innovation Fund, a venture capital firm that invests in the future of cities. The fund provides seed capital and regulatory support to entrepreneurs solving our toughest urban challenges \u2013 helping them grow into tomorrow\u2019s most valued companies. Previously, she co-founded Tumml, a startup hub for urban tech. The organization has provided 38 startups with seed funding and mentorship, and hosts thought leadership events around urban innovation. In 2014, Forbes listed her as one of its \u201c30 Under 30\u201d for Social Entrepreneurship. Clara\u2019s work energizing urban entrepreneurship has been featured in numerous press outlets, including MSNBC and TechCrunch, among others.
